title: Generalist/Full stack .Net programmer/developer
description: Challenging and stimulating role working with a Microsoft Certified Trainer on a variety of different projects and in different languages
salary: Competitive remuneration based on your experience
jobType: About Us  Dark Arts Limited is a development company that provides simple solutions for various companies who don't need a full-time IT team. We excel in our ability to produce technical solutions that help them grow their business and bring their ideas to life.  The Role  This is an opportunity to work in a small team led by a Microsoft Certified Trainer. Most of our projects are in the Finance, Insurance and Credit industries.  You must be a self-starter that is happy jumping into some older code and troubleshooting, but equally happy building new functionality. Someone who is able to focus and get the job done.  Ideally able to switch projects/languages easily and pick up new things quickly. Often working in a fairly unstructured manner and often without a full specification. We are very focused on deliverables so you need to be able to think on your feet.  We will consider hiring as a full-time employee or a contractor, depending on your preference and circumstances.  Location and Hours  Initially based in our Clevedon office, but we are open to some remote working with flexible hours once you are up to speed. This would probably suit a candidate that lives in South or East Auckland.  Knowledge & Experience  Must have;  Excellent English and communication skills Be living in NZ already and be able to commute to Clevedon Be eligible to work in New Zealand (i.e. citizenship or work visa or resident visa) 4-5 years development experience C# and preferably VB.Net HTML/CSS/Javascript/Jquery Kendo UI and preferably experience migrating from old versions to the new SASS based version SQL Server & good general SQL query skills Web Service development  Nice to haves;  Angular Java/JSP TypeScript  Must be able to work without a full specification, although I will generally guide development and design myself  Development cycles are fast with frequent production releases so you do need to be focused on deliverables  Rewards  Competitive remuneration based on your experience. Opportunity to work in a peaceful rural environment.

title: Test Engineer
description: You will have a big impact on the high quality of our product, testing and qualifying cutting edge technology for a world leader in network monitoring
jobType: Do you want to work for a locally owned, world leader in network monitoring technology?  Our unique product offering gives individuals the opportunity for continuous learning in a supportive team working on cutting edge technology. Our Test Engineers test and qualify Endace products and have the opportunity to have a big impact on the high quality of our market leading product.    Who We Are Looking For  To be successful, you will have a degree in a relevant discipline, and ideally experience working with technology, to give you;  Knowledge of computer and operating systems including Linux and Windows Knowledge of system and software testing methodologies An understanding of networking basics Familiarity with monitoring applications such as NetFlow, Snort, Wireshark Graduates will be considered.  We ask a lot, but we also like to ensure you are well looked after. Our comprehensive salary and benefits packages are at the top end of the market - if the business does well so will you. Free Friday lunches, excellent coffee machine, pool table and individual flexibility are just some of the perks on offer!     What We Do  Endace is an award winning, world leader in network monitoring technology, and we have offices based in New Zealand, Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States.  Our network recording and visibility solutions are used by some of the world's biggest companies to monitor some of the fastest, most powerful networks on the planet, increasing network security and performance. Banks and financial traders, healthcare organisations, telcos, retailers, governments and military trust Endace products to help manage critical data networks.  We partner with world-leading technology companies - such as Cisco, Darktrace, IBM, Palo Alto Networks, Splunk and many others - which leverage Endace technology to integrate high-speed packet capture into their solutions and host their applications on the EndaceProbe platform.    How you can be part of Endace  If you want to continue your career with technology and a team of capable, motivated individuals, we'd love to hear from you. You can apply now or find out more information, including the job description, atwww.endace.com or by contacting at careers@endace.com.  We are not an accredited organisation and will not be able to accept applications from those requiring sponsorship.  Endace is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and to creating an inclusive environment for all.

title: IT Desktop Support Engineer - Fixed Term Contract
description: Flexible work environment WFH Become part of one of the largest networks of its kind 24 Month Fixed Term Contract
jobType: Flexible work environment WFH Become part of one of the largest networks of its kind 24 Month Fixed Term Contract  Network for Learning (N4L) is a Crown-owned technology company that provides faster, safer internet for Aotearoa New Zealands schools and kura.  But were so much more than that.  Were focused on building a better tomorrow. By enhancing digital learning experiences in a smart and simple way, we make a meaningful difference to all learners.   About the Role Are you passionate about technology and looking to advance your IT support career?  Join our Infrastructure & Security team as an IT Support Engineer. You'll provide essential onsite support to our end-users, ensuring they have a seamless IT experience. Your role will involve supporting various systems and clients, requiring occasional after-hours work to resolve issues.  Responsibilities:  Provide day-to-day desktop support for end-user devices, mobile devices, and meeting room technologies. Help manage user accounts and applications like email, Google Suite and MacOS? Maintain and update internal IT documentation and procedures. Onboard and offboard staff, making sure they understand our IT processes. Handle daily tasks through the IT service desk, logging tickets, and escalating issues when necessary. Ensuring internal stakeholders have a positive customer experience  Experience:  Tertiary qualification in IT or related field We are open to hiring a grad or someone with experience in IT support or troubleshooting (1-2 years) Experience with Windows 10/11, Google Suite, MacOS, mobile devices (iPhone and Android), and printers. Basic knowledge of Intune, Azure, and Apple Business Manager is a bonus.  In order to be successful in this role, you will need :  Good communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to manage challenging situations and work with people at all levels. Self-starter with a proactive approach. Friendly, approachable, and able to stay calm under pressure. Excellent problem-solving skills and a commitment to learning new things.  Why work for N4L:  Our success has led to significant growth, providing our people with fantastic opportunities for personal development and varied work  no two days are the same!  We all have a strong sense of purpose, creating a caring, inclusive and innovative culture.
fullDescription: Help Desk & IT Support (Information & Communication Technology)

title: Retail Operations Data and Systems Specialist
description: Provide specialised systems and process reporting, offer data insights, and mitigate risk though the improvement and creation of reports.
jobType: We are one of New Zealand's largest energy retailers supplying electricity, natural gas and LPG, spread across the country. "With you, for you", aren't just words around here. We believe in succeeding together, growing with energy, and delivering a difference for our people, our customers and the communities we're part of. Working here, you'll be valued for the contribution you make and the part you play in helping Genesis become NZ's first choice for energy management.  About the role  As our Retail Operations Data and Systems Specialist you will provide dedicated support in data and systems for the Retail Operation team. You will be responsible for providing specialised systems and process reporting, offering data insights, and mitigating risk though the improvement / creation of reports that deliver control excellence.  Data Analytics & Reporting - Design, develop, and deliver reporting and insights through accurate and timely statistical analysis to influence the business managers in making data driven decisions. Governance Improvement Support - Support the uplift in governance capability to ensure lineage and metadata for all Retail Operations reporting and data are maintained. Performance Indicator Management - Support the Retail Operations Leadership team to build, measure and track key performance indicators within the Retail business unit. Regulatory Compliance Reporting- Ownership of compliance and regulatory reporting relating to Retail Operations. Backlog Prioritisation Management- working alongside Retail Operations Leadership team. Process Improvement - Identify and support the implementation of improvement opportunities including automation.  This is a permanent, full-time role based out of our modern Hamilton office.  About you  We are looking for an experienced Data and Analytics professional with strong analytical skills with the ability to determine causality beyond correlation. You'll need to a strong communicator, with the ability to convey complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences.  Proficiency in SQL, and similar data programming languages. Preferably an accreditation in big data platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP). Experience with integration and transformation tools (e.g., SSIS). Proficiency in creating reports using Power BI. Proven problem-solving skills. Excellent business acumen to support decision-makers in prioritising data asset builds based on business benefits.  About us  Our objective is to create and support an engaged culture by setting up our employees to succeed. We reward our staff with a strong remuneration and benefits package, a collaborative, fun culture, flexible working (hours, location, leave) and ongoing development opportunities to name a few. There isn't a one size fits all, so talk to us today about what'd make this role work for you.  Create your world of tomorrow, at Genesis.

title: Integration Architect
description: -One of the most reputed manufacturing brand -Hybrid/highly flexible -Newly created position -Auckland (1st preference) / Wellington (2nd choice)
jobType: 180k to 210k NZD (approximately depending upon levels)   Hybrid work culture / highly flexible   Competitive salary and benefits package   Lots of retail discounts   Auckland based (1st preference) ; open for Wellington for a very good candidate as well   Experience real transformation and not just talk about it   Report to the Head of Architecture & Engineering who believes in upliftment & growth of team members  About the organization:  Are you the kind of person who dreams in API calls and wakes up excited about seamless data flow?  Look no further!  Our client is on the lookout for an INTEGRATION ARCHITECT extraordinaire to join their tightly knit team in Auckland as a result of their massive digital transformation projects.  Join us as an Integration Architect and turn your tech wizardry into manufacturing magic!  This leader in the manufacturing industry is playing a key role in supporting New Zealand's economic growth and development. With a national network of branches and distribution centres, they offer a comprehensive range of products, services and solutions in their domain.  About the role:  The Integration architect will play a key role in designing and implementation of integration solutions that are aligned with organisations business objectives supporting the leadership in the development of near- and long-term roadmaps.  Solution & design end to end Solution architecture, recommend appropriate technology frameworks and transitioning from Solution to Enterprise Architecture.  Integration architecture - Ensure best practices , principles and standards such as scalability, reusability, reliability, security and maintainability.  Identify potential risks related to technology choice and implementation strategies from security perspective.  Provide technical leadership to the development team in this domain.  Your Skills and Experience:  You will have demonstrated experience as:  ESSENTIAL:  Someone who can talk about Integration architecture irrespective of libraries and platform, technology agnostic, has mentorship experience, has experience of enterprise architecture.  Designing & implementing complex integrated enterprise level solutions  Nonfunctional requirements like performance, security & data integrity  Domain driven design knowledge  Modern integration protocols (REST, WebSocket, JMS, GRPC etc )  Familiarity with enterprise business software & SaaS including CRM, ERP, MES & Integrations.  Exposure with Cloud (Azure/AWS/GCP) (He should be able to talk about Architecture irrespective of any specific platform)  GOOD TO HAVE:  Enterprise Architecture framework (TOGAF etc)  Experience in the manufacturing domain would be an advantage (not mandatory though).  Have a quality startup mindset in a secure environment!  If this role sounds like you, then please connect with dchoudhuri@welovesalt.com or Swati 0220606355 / DC @ 0225005159 for a confidential conversation.  #Integration #Architect #Architecture #Enterprisearchitect #Solutionarchitect #Togaf #Eventdrivenarchitecture  Pls note: A VALID NZ work visa is a pre-requisite. Offshore candidates with VALID working visa & open to relocate to NZ can apply.  We're proud to have been finalists for 2023 RCSA Awards in the Excellence in Client Service and Excellence in Candidate Care categories, and finalist for a 2023 SEEK Annual Recruitment Award in the Large Recruitment Agency of the Year category. At Salt, our mission is Creating Futures by putting our clients, candidates, partners, and team members at the heart of everything we do. We extend our sincere appreciation to everyone who has contributed to our continued success.

title: Technical Product Manager - Engineering Experience
description: Drive our strategy and product roadmap for our developer enablement function allowing Xero's engineering teams to ship products quicker to customers.
jobType: Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.  At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.  About the Team  The Engineering Experience portfolio is our developer enablement function, where we accelerate product teams by removing friction in their development process, so that customer value can be delivered with speed, safety and efficiency. We are at the forefront of technology adoption for Xero and provide platforms and tools that enable rapid development and innovation, and include some of the best and brightest technology talent in the locations where we operate.  About the Role  We are looking for two intermediate-level Product Managers to support driving business value through our developer enablement tooling, owning new and existing products that empower Xeros product and engineering teams to deliver towards their goals.  The key products for these roles include our external developer API gateway, third party developer tools, and uplifting Xeros testing capabilities.  In this role you will manage products end-to-end, working with Product and Engineering teams to help realise the implementation, and drive improvements over time. Your impact will be measured by key commercial and customer success metrics. You will be comfortable working autonomously where appropriate, with the support of your product leadership team.  This opportunity will be working in a very technical space, so knowledge about how software is developed, built, and supported is essential.  What you'll do Support developing roadmaps to help execute on the strategy, focusing on iterative value towards our team and company goals Work with customers, both internal to Xero and external, to collect and understand insights that help define and shape our products Build relationships with the broader product and engineering teams, influencing without authority and collaborating effectively with internal stakeholders Support our strategy for engineering focussed products and tooling to help realise Xeros technical goals Take responsibility for managing risks arising from non-functional concerns including security, privacy, regulatory change and compliance, accuracy, responsible data use and availability Work with your teams to establish team delivery cadence and rituals, facilitating these as required Monitor and analyse the ongoing performance of a product both from a commercial and customer perspective What you'll bring with you At least 2 years product management experience Experience in executing on roadmaps, being able to take plans and making them happen A background in working on software engineering problems, particularly in cloud based environments (for example, as a software engineer, or building capabilities for engineers) Some experience in working on product roadmaps, agile processes, defining stories and managing backlogs Strong communication skills that can adapt to the right audience, clearly and concisely A metrics driven minds, able to bring together multiple views and inputs, and turn that into requirements to support product development Why Xero?  Offering very generous paid leave to use however youd like (plus statutory holidays!), dedicated paid leave to care for your physical and mental wellbeing as well as an Employee Assistance Program to access mental health care for you and your family, free medical insurance, wellbeing and sports programmes, employee resource groups, 26 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, an Employee Share Plan, beautiful offices, flexible working, career development, and many other benefits that reflect our human value, youll do the best work of your life at Xero.

title: Senior Backend Developer C# .NET.
description: Our WhyDatacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in peoples lives and help organis
jobType: Our Why  Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in peoples lives and help organisations use the power of tech to innovate and grow.  A bit about Smartly, a Datacom company  We exist to make it simpler for Kiwi businesses to look after their people. Were known as the simple way to sort your payroll for over 20,000 businesses. Our slick software combined with our awesome support team help businesses pay their people on time, accurately and in line with legislation. As a fast-growing FinTech expanding into adjacent markets, Smartly offers a fast paced, fun work environment with great opportunities for personal and professional development.  About the Role (your why)  As a Senior C# .NET Developer, you will work on our Smartly Payroll System. Our ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of working on front and backend; also have great ability to solve problems, design & write clean code; and mentor other developers.  What youll bring  5+ years experience working on IT projects across multiple phases of the SDLC. Recent C# .NET experience and at least 5 years development experience in . Net Strong understanding in software architecture, design patterns, SOLID principles and object-oriented programming You will be confident in developing and mentoring in C#. Knowledge of software configuration management using tools such as Git. Familiarity with service-oriented frameworks. Ability to implement complex features and unit tests and fix complex bugs. Ability to lead more junior developers and provide guidance on best practices, design patterns. Leadership or pair programming experience is a bonus Public Cloud exposure (Azure) is a bonus.  What youll do  Work as part of a Product Squad in an Agile environment to design, code, test and install applications programs either in one major language or in a range of programs across multiple platforms. Analyse, debug and modify programs for enterprise or end user applications. Help mentor the more junior developers and sometimes do pair programming. Ensure that systems are developed within agreed budgets and time frames and achieve necessary design and systems security standards. Complete documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance. Monitor the performance and availability of systems hardware and software.  Why join us here at Datacom?  Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealands largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.  We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. Youll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment.  We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealands largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.  We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported.

title: Product Education Lead
description: Play a pivotal role in empowering our customers and global team with accurate and accessible knowledge about our product solutions.
jobType: About Gallagher  Our purpose at Gallagher is Protect what matters most and we live it every day. Not only does our technology protect some of the worlds highest security environments and agriculture businesses in over 160 countries, but our purpose also means we care deeply about our people and their families.  Weve been in business since 1938, and our high-tech animal management solutions are now sought after around the world. Within our Animal Management business, were passionate about putting our technology to work to make farm life easier and more profitable for our customers, ensuring a positive impact on environmental and animal welfare issues.    The Opportunity  Werelooking for a Product Education Lead to play a pivotal role in empowering our customers and global Animal Management team with accurate and accessible knowledge about our product solutions. This role will have a significant impact on the future of Animal Management education - enhancing service to customers and dealer/distributor networks, as well as educating our internal sales, customer service, and customer support teams.  With the support of the Chief Operations Officer  Animal Management, youll help develop a vision and strategy for the Product Education function within Animal Management. Youllfacilitate the creation of digital training and educational resources, engage with regional Animal Management teams to identify their specific market needs, and select the best technology platforms to disseminate knowledge across various stakeholders.    The Fit  This role will suit someone whos willing to hit the ground running and is happy to take on a wide variety of work. Youll have a passion for deeply understanding a business, its drivers, and customer needs, with the ability to create an innovative learning vision. With experience developing and deliveringdigitallearning strategies to grow capability across a varied audience, youll be able to produce brilliantly simple, accurateand high-quality work that shows empathy with the intended audience. To succeed in this roleyoull also have:  A relevant qualification in learning and development (or similar) or equivalent industry experience.  Demonstrated experience developing digital learning strategies (eLearning or similar). Proven experience in leading and mentoring teams. Extensive experience with information technology and utilising technology to deliver efficient learning outcomes. A strong portfolio showing diversity of work, breadth of experience and depth of technical understanding/delivery. A strong end-to-end creative design skill set, including project and stakeholder relationship management. The ability to work with the team to prioritise work based on impact and value.  Strong emotional intelligence (EQ) to enable effective engagement with a variety of cultures and personality types.    Why Gallagher?  At Gallagher, we foster a supportive and family-friendly work environment, where collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement are at the forefront of everything we do. We value work-life balance and prioritise the well-being of our employees.  With operations in New Zealand, Australia, Asia, Africa, USA, Canada, the UK and Europe and exports across the world, we provide our employees unrivalled globally focused career pathways.We also offer:  Competitive salary and annual bonus opportunities. An easily accessible office location, free parking, subsidised on-sitecafand great eateries nearby. Development opportunities and career pathways with a truly global organisation. Plenty of fun along the way with a supportive and friendly team!  Make a significant impact in Gallagher's Animal Management team and contribute to the success of our global business. Apply now to become a valued member of #TeamGallagher.

title: Practice Lead - Data & Analytics
description: Lead our Data & Analytics team providing Databricks solutions to our customers, work with some of the leading brands in the New Zealand marketplace!
jobType: Our Why  Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in peoples lives and help organisations use the power of tech to innovate and grow.  About the Role  This is a key, strategic role within Datacom, tasked with driving growth, innovation and ultimately commercial success for a market facing proposition.  Working within the Digital Engineering division you will lead your team on Data & Analytics with a focus on Databricks.  Leveraging the power of Databricks and other leading tech, you will be able to design, develop and implement data solutions that solve our customer business challenges. You will take responsibility for growing a high performing team, combining your deep technical expertise with strong commercial awareness to craft, position and sell development related services.  A willingness to work collaboratively with our internal teams, our clients and understanding our clients customers. A good understanding of different delivery methods across agile and product is advantageous.  What youll do (Your Why):  Team Leadership: Define and execute the capability plan to create a culture of success, including team growth, performance, and development. Technical Leadership: Provide expert guidance and technical leadership on the development of cloud solution s and cloud native development. Sales: Articulate and evangelise the Modern Application development value proposition across Sales, Service and Marketing to internal stakeholders, customers and the wider market. Strategic direction: Consult with the wider business to define and execute a growth strategy for the Modern Application services business across Wellington and wider markets. Commercial and financial management: Create and manage the operational budget, including month-end processes, invoicing and reporting. Partner Engagement: Lead strategic planning around opportunity and product roadmaps to ensure we work with our partners both efficiently and with impact.  What youll bring  The Practice Lead role in Datacom is a senior position leading a specialised area within our high-performing Digital Engineering business.  With responsibility spanning the entire process from capability development to identifying business value and managing delivery this is a challenging role demanding the highest level of people, technical and business skill. Youll utilise your deep technical experience in Data & Analytics technologies to provide insight and solutions to our large set of customers across New Zealand.  We need someone with solid technical knowledge, so experience and technical leadership roles involving Data Solutions is a definite must. As you build your Practice you will be happy rolling up your sleeves with hands on delivery, so you need to have experience implementing end to end solutions in the past and be up to date with the latest technology.  You come with demonstrable experience driving growth, managing commercial operations and leading innovation. You will have excellent people skills, commercial acumen, and a solid understanding of software professional services delivery.  This is a unique opportunity to realise the potential of Data & Analytics within a premier technology brand. You will have the autonomy and freedom to lead, working with some of the brightest minds in the business.  Why join us here at Datacom?  Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealands largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.  We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. Youll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment.  We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealands largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.  We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported.      Requirements   Extensive knowledge of Databricks architecture and features. Proven track-record in the design, development and implementation of data solutions using Databricks. Experience in data ingestion tools such as Apache Kafka, Informatica, AWS Glue, Azure event hubs, Fivetran, Matillion, DBT and Coalesce. Experience in Apache Airflow. Minimum 4+ years experience in design, development and implementation of data solutions using Databricks.

title: Payroll Analyst
description: Be part of an exciting period of transformation for Suncorp!
jobType: Are you ready to Chase the Sun? A career with Suncorp gives you the chance to do that every day, while also helping New Zealanders to build futures and protect what matters.  There has never been a more important time to be part of the insurance industry, responding to changing customer needs, adapting to regulatory change and facing into social and environmental issues.  Our People and Culture team are going through an exciting period of change and are looking for a Payroll Analyst to support with the delivery of their People Home project, one of Suncorps strategic objectives. This role will be a 12-month Fixed Term position.  In this role you will be working closely with the Payroll Product Owner and NZ Payroll Advisor to deliver an enhanced payroll proposition for Suncorp NZ.  What youll do:  Provide payroll subject matter expertise, throughout the project lifecycle Work collaboratively with delivery teams and business stakeholders to gather, validate and document business requirements and develop recommendations and solutions that meet business and customer needs. Create detailed user stories to support delivery. Conduct data analysis and produce ad hoc reports to support data migration. Collaborate with system specialists on system design and gap analysis, ensuring alignment with project objectives. Raise, and support mitigation and resolution of, risks and issues using established tools and frameworks were applicable.  What youll bring:  Minimum 5 years experience working with Payroll and Time & Labour systems; Datapay experience would be preferred. Demonstrated experience in a complex payroll project environment. Strong understanding of payroll processes, regulations, and legislative compliance requirements, particularly with the Holidays Act. Operational experience and technical skills across the full payroll spectrum, for New Zealand. Demonstrated ability to interpret complex payroll and regulatory requirements and translate them into system requirements. Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Experience building successful business relationships with, and influencing, stakeholders. Experience with Agile, Lean and waterfall methodology would be advantageous.  What we can offer you:  Fixed term 12 month contract. Competitive salary Positive, inclusive team environment where we welcome individuality and celebrate diversity. Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance Ongoing learning and development opportunities  About Us:  Were proud to be a part of the Suncorp Group family alongside some of Australia and New Zealands most trusted names in insurance  working together to bring about faster, simpler and better outcomes for our customers and corporate partners. Our commitment to strong, supportive partnerships extends to our people as well, and the opportunities and support we provide to help you thrive in your career with us. And with a shared customer-obsession and the digital capabilities to make a genuine difference, youll see the meaningful impact you can make for our customers and communities, while watching your own career shine too.  Chasing the sun means pursuing your passions, fulfilling your potential and getting that much closer to the future thats just beyond the horizon. If thats a future you want to see, then your time in the sun starts here  with a Suncorp career. Apply now!

title: Lead Technical Business Analyst - Payments
description: Lead Technical Business Analyst Payments Industry Long Term Rolling Contract Hybrid Role: Wellington Office & WFH Daily Rate: Negotiable D.O.E.
jobType: A great opportunity has opened up for Lead Technical Business Analyst to join a highly reputable global payments company based in Wellington.  Contract: 6 Months initially with the view of going on to a long term rolling contract Hybrid: 3 days Onsite Wellington Office and 2 days WFH Daily Rate: Negotiable depending on experience Start Date: ASAP (will work with max. 2 weeks notice)  The Role Overview:  Your primary objective is to co-ordinate the analysis and design of systems and processes according to customer requirements to improve business efficiency and productivity. You will undertake process analysis, design and documentation. Your knowledge of the product and latest releases is kept up to date as you configure applications to client specifications. Working with developers and end users you ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction.  Essential Criteria:  Minimum 5 years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst to include at least 1 years experience within the payments industry Solid knowledge and experience in card schemes (Visa and Mastercard) and Transaction processing (AS2805 and ISO8583) Ability to develop a broad awareness of the technical architecture and emerging technologies with enough knowledge to determine what is and is not possible Ability to understand and capture business and technical requirements Tertiary qualifications in business, information technology or related discipline essential Knowledge of Agile methodologies with experience with Atlassian tool set Jira or Confluence  If you meet the above criteria and interested please apply today via the link with your updated resume in a Word document to Claire Sheerin at The Recruitment Company.

title: Cloud and Infrastructure Engineer
description: Be part of a professional and driven Digital Business team, with a transformational scope of work underway. Apply now!
jobType: About the role  We are on the lookout for a Cloud and Infrastructure Engineer who can help take our existing Infrastructure as well as our IaaS and PaaS services to the next level. With a transformational scope of work underway, we require an Engineer that takes pride in delivering the best, scalable and secure solutions using the latest technologies. The role will be part of a talented team of engineers, reporting to the Infrastructure Manager, on a fixed term contract for 12 months, and can be based in either Auckland, Tauranga, or Hamilton.  The key focus of the Cloud and Infrastructure Engineer role is to support, administer and evolve the ICT services required by the business across all levels. ICT services encompass infrastructure inclusive of Virtual and Physical Desktops and Servers, Cloud IaaS/PaaS/SaaS, Bespoke and Standard Applications, Network and Telecommunications areas.  The primary responsibilities of this role include the design, implementation, configuration, control, maintenance, monitoring, and continuous improvement of these infrastructure services to ensure maximum availability of ICT to the business users in alignment with the IT SLA.  About you  We are looking for candidates with relevant IT qualifications or equivalent work experience, who can demonstrate technical expertise and demonstrate the following:  Configuring, monitoring and maintaining Cloud services, e.g. Azure, Office365, MS365, Azure AD, SharePoint, Intune, Teams and other Vendor IaaS/PaaS/SaaS services. Delivery of solutions with MS Azure across security, virtualization, migration, and automation whilst ensuring scalability and stability. Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for the provisioning of cloud resources, specifically Terraform HCL preferred. Experience with Hyperconverged technology, Virtualization and networking (VMware preferred) Working knowledge of Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops Management and maintenance of configuration tools and images, including patch deployment and image updates utilizing SCCM/Intune or similar Experience and in depth understanding of Windows OS on both servers and desktops Analytical and problem-solving skills Strong procedure and documentation skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with clients, staff, managers, partners and suppliers Professional and flexible approach  This is a position suiting someone with initiative and a proactive attitude. A background in the financial sector and an understanding of financial business applications from a customer's perspective will be highly regarded.  About the Company  Craigs Investment Partners (Craigs) is a multi-award-winning investment advisory firm which is one of the largest in New Zealand. With 19 offices located throughout the country, and over 600 employees, Craigs offers solutions and advice to both private investors, as well as corporate and institutional clients.  Why Craigs?  We pride ourselves on creating an environment where our people feel they belong and can bring their best self to work and feel valued. We grow as a team and with our clients and are always looking to support our communities  both internal and external. Our values build the foundation of how we work and how we provide great outcomes for our people and our clients.  We are stronger together We strive for excellence We put people first We do whats right  If you would like to find out more about working at Craigs, visit our Careers page  https://craigsip.com/careers  How to apply  If you are interested in the role, please submit your application online now as we will be interviewing suitable candidates as they apply.  For a copy of the Job Description visit HO_Cloud-and-Infrastructure-Engineer---August2024.pdf

title: Full Stack Developer - .NET, SQL
description: Join our highly skilled team to provide clients a tailor-made finance solution, configurable down to the finest detail.
jobType: Do you want to work on projects where youre actually trusted and empowered to make meaningful change for some of Australasias leading companies?  Dream of working in a place you can call home rather than have to change your career every two years to get ahead?  Want to be part of a team that focuses on getting the job done and having a good time while doing it?  If you answered yes...then we should talk!  Were Sandfield and we build smart software solutions for some of Australasias top brands.  OnAccount is Sandfields enterprise-level Financial Management System. Designed and developed in NZ, we've been fine-tuning it for over 20 years. Its part of Sandfields DNA, breaking the mould of conventional accounting systems. Used by some of Australasia's most successful supply chain and travel companies. Check us out here: https://onaccount.co.nz/  Our uniquely highly skilled team provide clients a tailor-made finance solution, configurable down to the finest detail. Our system continually adapts with them as their business landscape shifts and grows.  We have an opportunity in our OnAccount team for an Intermediate full stack developer to join us in developing varied codebases and delivering solutions for clients in NZ and overseas. You will be a full stack developer across SQL, .Net, Javascript, and React, and you can adapt to a dynamic environment with changing priorities. For the right person, this unique role offers plenty of client interaction, code variety, and scope for development.  As our team all work directly with our clients, ideally you will have experience working closely with clients and are a strong communicator. Previous accounting knowledge or exposure to accounting systems is a plus.  About Sandfield  Were a leading, Kiwi-owned software business that prides itself on NOT just being a conventional tech company.  We've been backing ourselves and our ability to create great solutions for clients, since we first opened our doors in 1989. Since then, weve developed some pretty innovative systems for clients, leaving other, more high-profile software packages in the dust.  Our work facilitates high-performance supply chains for the likes of Mainfreight, Qube and HW Richardsons and keeps millions of orders and data points flowing for Foodstuffs. It also manages business finances for Team Global Express and Green Acres, helps fill seats on the Interislander for KiwiRail and keeps Les Mills members engaged...plus so much more.  Our pitch to you  We guarantee you that every day will be interesting, varied, challenging and fun! Youll get to work with a range of other smart developers of all levels, who also happen to be really great people.  Theyre mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, runners, active relaxers, video gamers, animal lovers, movie buffs, gym buffs, foodies, wine critics, bakers and musicians. Theyre also family people, single people, party people, quiet people, loud people and happy people.  Our collaborative culture is at the centre of everything we do at Sandfield, making it a pretty special workplace. We know this because people also dont tend to leave - i.e. the average length of service here is at least five years.  We also have a drinks fridge, funky offices and fun food evenings!  But dont just take our word for it - heres what our people say about Working at Sandfield  As an organisation, were also very conscious of our environmental footprint and are currently on a journey to become carbon neutral in the very near future.  Our tech stack  We work across a variety of technologies, although we specialise in a Microsoft stack. We always select the right technology based on our client's needs. We primarily build web-based applications but also have opportunities for mobile development.  To be successful, you will have:  Microsoft SQL Server .NET - WebAPI, MVC or WebForms HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Knowledge of functional React, preferably 16.8+ General interest or knowledge of financial systems and business processes An interest in all aspects of the SDLC In-depth knowledge of ES6 syntax Experience using a 3rd party component library (MaterialUI) In-depth knowledge of Git, including standard development lifecycle (feature branching, pull requests, CI/CD) Flexibility to work across both legacy and newer technologies Some experience writing system documentation  When you work for us, youll enjoy:  Rapid career advancement based on initiative and performance A huge variety of work A relaxed, supportive and social environment An opportunity to work alongside some highly experienced developers The freedom to employ creative thinking and really make a difference to our clients businesses A flat team structure that emanates lots of positive energy! Flexible working policy Soft skills training Regular social events and Fun Food Evenings A well-stocked drink fridge (including non-alcoholic) and fruit bowl Fareshare discount of 75%on public transport travel to the office  Make your next move with us!  If you want to join a great team and be part of the driving force behind some innovative tech solutions for a range of top companies in this part of the world, then lets talk!  Even if youre comfortable in your current role, but want to explore future opportunities, it could still be worthwhile having a chat with us.

title: Test Engineer
description: You will have a big impact on the high quality of our product, testing and qualifying cutting edge technology for a world leader in network monitoring
jobType: Do you want to work for a locally owned, world leader in network monitoring technology?  Our unique product offering gives individuals the opportunity for continuous learning in a supportive team working on cutting edge technology. Our Test Engineers test and qualify Endace products and have the opportunity to have a big impact on the high quality of our market leading product.    Who We Are Looking For  To be successful, you will have a degree in a relevant discipline, and ideally experience working with technology, to give you;  Knowledge of computer and operating systems including Linux and Windows Knowledge of system and software testing methodologies An understanding of networking basics Familiarity with monitoring applications such as NetFlow, Snort, Wireshark Graduates will be considered.  We ask a lot, but we also like to ensure you are well looked after. Our comprehensive salary and benefits packages are at the top end of the market - if the business does well so will you. Free Friday lunches, excellent coffee machine, pool table and individual flexibility are just some of the perks on offer!     What We Do  Endace is an award winning, world leader in network monitoring technology, and we have offices based in New Zealand, Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States.  Our network recording and visibility solutions are used by some of the world's biggest companies to monitor some of the fastest, most powerful networks on the planet, increasing network security and performance. Banks and financial traders, healthcare organisations, telcos, retailers, governments and military trust Endace products to help manage critical data networks.  We partner with world-leading technology companies - such as Cisco, Darktrace, IBM, Palo Alto Networks, Splunk and many others - which leverage Endace technology to integrate high-speed packet capture into their solutions and host their applications on the EndaceProbe platform.    How you can be part of Endace  If you want to continue your career with technology and a team of capable, motivated individuals, we'd love to hear from you. You can apply now or find out more information, including the job description, atwww.endace.com or by contacting at careers@endace.com.  We are not an accredited organisation and will not be able to accept applications from those requiring sponsorship.  Endace is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and to creating an inclusive environment for all.

title: Applications Analyst
description: You will work closely with our Solutions Architect and Applications Support Analyst maintaining and improving our CRM and Training Management System.
jobType: Applications Analyst  Christchurch, Auckland  Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)  Full time  What Careerforce does  Careerforce works with over 2,000 employers across Aotearoa to deliver workplace-based training, supporting over 15,000 learners annually towards nationally recognised and life-changing qualifications across the health & wellbeing sectors  Why work for Careerforce?  We are a passionate team who really cares about improving the health and wellbeing of New Zealanders through workforce development. We are looking for someone that shares our passion and fits with our character and values.  Investing in our employees is important to us. We want out employees to thrive, and we do this through professional development at all levels. We offer accredited professional development support and study leave if eligible.   We offer flexible working and we wont make you work your birthday, we will give you the day off. We will also give you one day per year to volunteer for your favourite charity or do something that helps others.  To support the health of our staff, we subsidise a range of wellbeing services. This includes free annual flu vaccinations, discounted health insurance through Southern Cross and a discount at Specsavers.  Our EAP partner is far more than a safety net, it is a platform for cultivating mental wellness, promoting work-life balance, and fostering a supportive workplace culture. All employees have access to EAP and Careerforce takes a considerate approach to offering professional supervision.  Where will you be based?  Careerforce operates offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch, and supports a team of remote employees. This position requires you to reside either in Auckland or Christchurch with the flexibility to work in a combination of office and home environments.  About the role  You will work closely with our Solutions Architect and Applications Support Analyst maintaining and improving our CRM and Training Management System, as well as managing the implementation of CRM enhancements, data management, change and service management, and reporting. A proactive role that can develop technical solutions for both our CRM and our integrated learning platforms. This role develops, maintains, and enhances a range of applications. The role will work closely with IT team members, product teams, and project teams leading technical solution design, and advice. We are looking for someone with proven experience and technical skills in maintaining and improving business critical applications. Note: This is not an IT service desk role.  In addition to the above requirements, we are excited about the future of AI and its potential to drive data-driven decisions, enhance customer experiences, and optimise operations. If you possess the necessary skills for the role and have a keen interest in developing your skills to leverage AI for business innovation, we want to hear from you!  Our ideal candidate is someone who:  Has experience in managing Dynamic 365 preferably with 2016 on prem version.  Is able to demonstrate a high level of trouble shooting and problem-solving skills.  Is able to interpret, extract and analyse data.  Experience in Dynamics 365 & Power platforms (on prem version desirable)  Experience in Power Automate building plug-ins, JavaScript, custom scripts.Must be comfortable in C#, .NET & Web Services  Proficiency in writing SQL queries and expertise in creating reports in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) for the creation and maintenance of reports.  Understanding and/or experience with integration platforms.Logic Apps/Azure Integration will be viewed preferably  Excellent communication, both written and verbal  Ability to analyse and support integration solutions.  Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills  Attention to detail, data accuracy and efficiency are essential to the success of this role.  You will also need to demonstrate the following:  An appropriate qualification and / or experience in information systems including databases and applications.  Experience with business process analysis and mapping into a CRM.  A collaborative mindset with a willingness to share knowledge and learn new skills  If this sounds like you, then please get in touch!  Enquiries can be directed to:  Annette Clennell, Senior People and Capability Advisor  Annette.Clennell@careerforce.org.nz  To obtain a Job Description, please visit our website:  https://www.careerforce.org.nz/about/work-for-us/vacancies/  Please apply for this role via Seek, by submitting your CV and Cover Letter, telling us how your skills and experience match this role, and why you want to work with us at Careerforce.  Applications close:Friday 16th August 2024 at 5pm

description: The Business System Analyst is responsible for gathering, analysing, and documenting business requirements to support the business.
jobType: Business Systems Analyst (Digital)  Christchurch, Auckland  Analyst (Information & Communication Technology)  Full time  What Careerforce does  Careerforce works with over 2,000 employers across Aotearoa to deliver workplace-based training, supporting over 15,000 learners annually towards nationally recognised and life-changing qualifications across the health & wellbeing sectors. This role ensures that technology applications fully support the achievement of our strategic goals and are aligned with business expectations and outcomes. You will work closely with a dynamic team, liaise with various business units, and ensure that each project is aligned with the overall strategic goals. A collaborative mindset with a willingness to share knowledge and learn new skills Practical experience using a CRM and other software is a must You will have demonstrated your ability to form strong working relationships with stakeholders at all levels of an organisation Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities. title: Senior React Developer.
description: Our WhyDatacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in peoples lives and help organ
jobType: Our Why  Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in peoples lives and help organisations use the power of tech to innovate and grow.  A bit about Smartly, a Datacom company  We exist to make it simpler for Kiwi businesses to look after their people. Were known as the simple way to sort your payroll for over 20,000 businesses. Our slick software combined with our awesome support team help businesses pay their people on time, accurately and in line with legislation. As a fast-growing FinTech expanding into adjacent markets, Smartly offers a fast paced, fun work environment with great opportunities for personal and professional development.  About the Role (your why)  As a Senior React Developer, you will work on our Smartly Payroll System. Our ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of working on front and backend; also have great ability to solve problems, design & write clean code; and mentor other developers.    What you'll bring  5+ years experience working on IT projects across multiple phases of the SDLC. At least 3 years React development experience A deep understanding of JS and React You will be confident in developing and mentoring in React Knowledge of software configuration management using tools such as Git. Ability to implement complex features and unit tests and fix complex bugs. Ability to lead more junior developers and provide guidance on best practices, design patterns Nice to haves are: Some development experience in .Net. Some full stack web development experience. Public Cloud exposure (Azure)  What youll do  Work as part of a Product Squad in an Agile environment to design, code, test and install applications programs either in one major language or in a range of programs across multiple platforms. Analyse, debug and modify programs for enterprise or end user applications. Help mentor the more junior developers and sometimes do pair programming. Ensure that systems are developed within agreed budgets and time frames and achieve necessary design and systems security standards. Complete documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance. Monitor the performance and availability of systems hardware and software.  Why join us here at Datacom?  Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealands largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.  We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. Youll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment.  We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealands largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.  We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported.

title: Software Developer
description: Hiring 2 Software Developers to join a leading PropTech business in New Zealand
jobType: Employer/Company: Renti Limited  Location of Work: Level 1, 99 Khyber Pass Road, Grafton, Auckland 1023,New Zealand  Full time, Permanent position  Vacant position:Software Developer    About us  Renti is the leading tenancy application tool used by thousands of property managers and tenants across the country to help make moving into their new rental home enjoyable and easy. As part of the connections team, you will be assisting the tenant with reconnecting their electricity, gas and internet services.  Renti is an exciting and disruptive early stage SaaS scale up focusing on all things renting.  Our company tagline is Less Hassle, More Living and we believe that everyone deserves the space to live, and at Renti, we're helping make that happen.  We understand the renting process can be tough, so were tackling it head-on with simple easy-to-use tools, transforming the renting journey into a hassle-free adventure.  We're not just about finding a place to live; we're about giving you more time to enjoy the things you love.  Team culture is very important to us. The Renti team is a very close-knit team that enjoys having fun together while building and delivering exciting new products. We are excited to grow our team with like-minded individuals who are passionate about what they do and looking to help build amazing products.    About the role:  Position/role: We are looking to hire 2Software Developersforour team in Auckland.  Type of employment: This is a full-time, permanent position.  Place of work: Our business is based at Level 1, 99 Khyber Pass Road, Grafton, Auckland 1023, New Zealand  Hours of work: Your normal hours of work will be Monday to Friday, from Monday to Friday, from 8:30am to 5:30 pm.  As this is a full-time employment, we guarantee a minimum of 30 hours of work per week with usual/ normal hours being 40 hours of guaranteed work per week. Any additional hours, overtime if required by the business, would be mutually agreed with you in advance, and would not exceed 45 hours of work per week.  Remuneration: The base salary is $80,000.00 per annum. Salary is paid monthly in the Employees bank account.  Overtime: Any additional hours, overtime (if any) would be paid at the hourly rate of $38.46 per hour.  Other terms and conditions of the proposed employment:  Holidays and leave in accordance with the Holidays Act 2003. Annual leave of 4 weeks 10 days of sick leave Work on public holiday entitlements in accordance with the relevant New Zealand law (Holidays Act 2003) Bereavement leave of 3 days (upon the death of your spouse (including a de facto spouse), parent, child, brother, sister, grandparent, grandchild or spouses parent)and1 bereavement leave on any other occasion on which we accept that you have suffered a bereavement) Parental leave in accordance with the Parental Leave and Employment Protection Act 1987 Other leave (e.g. conference leave, extended bereavement leave), paid or unpaid, where we consider that to be appropriate. Compliance with required health and safety standards Compliance with organization policies and rules    The purpose of the role and duties involved:  We are seeking a talented Software Developer. As a Software Developer at Renti, you will play a pivotal role in the ongoing development and enhancement of our platform. You will collaborate closely with our cross-functional team of developers, designers, and product managers to deliver high-quality software solutions that exceed customer expectations.  As a Software Developer in our company, your day to date duties will be:  Execute full software development lifecycle Reviewing the work of peers for accuracy, functionality and readability Proactively researching and obtaining information relevant to both the technical and user experience of the product Assisting as a mentor to other team members, providing guidance and constructive criticism in an encouraging manner. Generating ideas with team members and offering insightful solutions Front and back-end development of websites and apps Meeting tight deadlines with a cool head Writing well-designed and testable code Document and maintain software functionality Maintaining and innovating on Software and Cloud infrastructure Attending meetings and briefings with clients and peers Taking responsibility for all development work and ownership of thorough quality control Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends, and actively contribute to continuous learning and knowledge sharing within the team. Contribute to the design, development, and testing of new features and enhancements for the Renti platform. Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using best practices and modern development methodologies. Collaborate with team members to identify technical requirements, propose solutions, and implement improvements. Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality, reliability, and performance. Troubleshoot and debug issues, and provide timely resolutions to technical challenges.  About you:  The ideal candidate would for the role would need to meet the following requirements:  Work experience:  Minimum of 3 year of relevant and applicable professional work experience for the role, including professional work experience in software development, with a strong proficiency in one or more programming languages.  Other attributes and skills:  Strong written and verbal communication skills Excellent coding and digital development abilities The confidence to express ideas as part of a creative team A clear and genuine interest in technological trends The ability to meet deadlines and think strategically A passionate approach to work with a desire to push boundaries and do great things The ability to explain technical jargon to peers and the ability to build a website from start to finish to the highest standards  Benefits  Competitive salary. Professional growth and development opportunities.  If you're passionate about technology and eager to join a fast-paced startup environment where your contributions will make a real difference, we'd love to hear from you! Apply now to become part of the Renti team and help us redefine the future of renting.

title: Data Scientist
description: Junior Data Scientist - Problem Solver - Python - Advisory - READ ON!
jobType: About the organisation A fantastic opportunity to work for a data driven company who've been in the market for over 10 years and built a solid reputation through their advisory practice, product development and data engineering teams. They are growing both in Wellington and Auckland and now looking for additional fire power in their Data Science team.  We're after a Junior level Data Scientist who thrives in a customer driven environment, loves to solve real problems and deliver outstanding service.  About the role:  Take the customer on the journey with you by interpreting their needs into actions, designing solutions that give them value, and delivering a solution that surpasses their expectations. Do the analysis and build statistical models, develop statistical methodologies, write the code, interpret and communicate the results. Collaborate effectively with data scientists, engineers, designers, and other team members to deliver the project. What you need:  1-2 years of experience in roles working with data/insights. Ability to solve analytical problems using quantitative approaches Postgraduate qualification in a relevant technical field (for example: Maths, Stats, OR, Data Science, Engineering and/or Computer Science) Programming experience preferably R or Python (SAS also useful) Familiarity with relational databases and SQL Project management experience communicating with clients and interpreting their needs.
