title: Customer AI Lead
description: Lead transformative projects but also to become a pivotal part of our AI journey, driving innovations that make a real difference.
jobType: About the role  As the AI Lead at Halter, you will be at the forefront of integrating AI into our customer service operations. This is your chance to lead the development of a world-class Knowledge Management System (KMS) and drive our goal of achieving an 80% resolution rate from AI interactions. You'll oversee the customer content team and ensure seamless AI integration across support, onboarding, and ultimately sales. Join us in doing the coolest AI work in New Zealand today! This is your chance to not only lead transformative projects but also to become a pivotal part of our AI journey, driving innovations that make a real difference.  Who were looking for  Were looking for a unique individual - someone who is very comfortable stepping into a one-of-a-kind role and building it up from scratch. Youll constantly be pushing to the very edge of where you operate, testing new and unique solutions to solve hard problems, and anchoring your decision-making in data. At all times you will have our farmer experience at the core of what you do. The right person for this position will be incredibly collaborative, working cross-functionally to drive a digital-first strategy that operates cohesively within our total customer experience offering. Youll be someone who has experience working in the tech space, and have a keen interest in integrating AI advancements within an organisation. Were open to diverse backgrounds - engineering, research, coding, product, professional services, operations - as long as you are a brilliant doer and thinker with a passion for this work.  What your day could look like  Strategic AI Implementation: Lead the development and implementation of AI strategies for the Customer team, enhancing our KMS to a world-class level. Resolution Rate Optimisation: Drive initiatives to achieve an 80% resolution rate from AI, continuously improving AI models and customer interactions. AI in Customer Support: Integrate AI solutions into our support framework, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our customer service. Onboarding and Sales Integration: Extend AI capabilities to support onboarding processes and sales operations, ensuring a cohesive AI strategy across all customer touchpoints. Team Leadership: Manage and mentor the customer content team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment. Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of AI trends and technologies, implementing the latest advancements to keep Halter at the cutting edge of AI innovation. Pathway to Leadership: This role isnt just about leading AI for our Customer teamits a stepping stone to shaping Halters entire commercial AI strategy. You'll have the opportunity to expand your influence across all aspects of our business, driving AI innovations that revolutionize the agricultural industry. Your success in this role could see you taking the helm of our AI vision, steering Halter to new heights and setting the standard for AI excellence globally.  Why our team loves working at Halter  Every now and again a company comes along that disrupts and transforms an entire industry, leaving society in a better place. Few people get the opportunity to work at companies like these. Halter is an incredible technology transforming an essential industry. We have a genuine and shared connection to our mission to make a difference in the world. Our product changes the lives of our customers, directly improving their livelihoods and their lifestyle. Your work matters. Dedicate yourself to solving real-world problems alongside an epic team in a high-growth culture. The excitement, risk and reward of a high-growth technology scale-up on the global stage. Our ideas are truly valued, we are able to move fast, and our impact is real. State-of-the-art, dog-friendly office thats been thoughtfully designed right in the heart of Auckland city. Healthy body, healthy mind. Were partnered with Southern Cross Health Insurance to support your well-being. We offer 6 months of fully paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 4 weeks of fully paid secondary caregiver leave and many other parental benefits that support you and your family. Our personal growth is important. Halter offers an annual $1000 self-development budget to be used for anything that fuels personal growth. Our time to recharge is valued, were offered wellness leave and unlimited paid annual leave. We offer an inclusive and attractive remuneration package made up of salary, benefits and an employee stock ownership plan. Delicious snacks and drinks are available for your daily flow.  Our Office First Approach  Theres a reason you visit your friends in person, live with your family and dont do dinners over Zoom. Humans are wired for connection. We believe a world-class, in-person office culture is the best way for high-performing teams.  Being office first is a core pillar of our culture. We believe in-person connections are key to driving your own growth, learning, impact, and building genuine long-lasting relationships. Strong relationships make it easier to disagree, give feedback, and do meaningful and aligned work. We dont like having heaps of rules or policies, but this means having strong, trusted relationships is critical.  Were office first, not office only. This means working from the office everyday is our default setting, but we flex when we need to. We have a high-trust culture, so everyone is trusted to do whats best for Halter.  Our office vibe is something special, its hard to describe until youre here, but people at Halter who have come from fully remote or hybrid companies say they could never go back - the high energy and spectacular people they are now surrounded by everyday makes work so enjoyable. Your growth, your learning and your impact is truly unlimited here, and a big part of that comes from being together solving problems, innovating, building context, and constantly learning from each other.  About Halter  The future of food production hinges on an important question: How do we feed the worlds growing population without compromising our natural resources? Farmers feed our population and hold the keys to vital climate solutions. At Halter, were on a mission to enable farmers to run the most productive and sustainable farms. Farmers are using Halter to break free from the time-intensive constraints of conventional farming. Theyre growing more grass, increasing production and improving the health and wellbeing of their cattle.  We bridge deep tech into farming. Halter enables farmers to remotely shift, virtually fence and proactively monitor their cows health and behaviour. Can you imagine watching 500 dairy cows turn in unison and walk calmly towards the milking shed? Or beef cattle, behind virtual fences, happily grazing with their calves? No quad bikes, no dogs, no fences. Just a mob of cows walking at their own pace. People say it looks like magic. Our customers are revolutionizing farming with Halter. It's changing lives and transforming an industry.  People join Halter because they want to do meaningful work. By joining us youll be solving challenging problems within a talented team and a culture built for high performance. Our team out-think, out-work and out-care. Were committed to delivering real change in the world - this isnt easy, and in truth, we love that its hard. Were backed to deliver on a mission that matters by Tier 1 investors includingBessemer Venture Partners,DCVC,Blackbird,Promus Ventures, Rocket Labs Peter Beck andIcehouse ventures.  To find out more, visit our careers website (careersathalter.com), LinkedIn & Instagram (@lifeathalter).  Join our team  Halter is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace  a place where we can each be ourselves and do the best work of our lives. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the requirements, women and under-represented groups of candidates tend to only apply when they meet every requirement. If you think you have what it takes but dont necessarily tick every requirement on this job description, please still get in touch and apply to Halter. Wed love to chat to see if youll be an epic fit!  If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply below by sending through your cover letter explaining why youre excited about this role and working at Halter, along with your CV, and well be in touch!  Please also feel free to check out the careers and culture page (careersathalter.com) for more information on working at Halter and don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram (@lifeathalter).

title: Engineering Manager
description: Our client is seeking an Engineering Manager to play a pivotal role in their dynamic team.
jobType: This position offers the opportunity to lead and nurture a talented group of engineers, driving excellence in engineering practices across all disciplines. The successful candidate will be instrumental in fostering a culture of accountability and responsibility around delivery, ensuring consistent, high-quality product outcomes. This role provides the chance to make a significant impact on the company's growth trajectory, with opportunities for personal and professional development.  What you'll do:  As an Engineering Manager, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our client's engineering practice. You will collaborate with teams across the organisation, ensuring that their product, platform, and ways of working continue to support their users as they grow. Your leadership will inspire your team to strive for excellence in all areas of their work. You'll also have the opportunity to recruit new talent into the team, further enhancing its capabilities. Your ability to build strong relationships will enable you to identify problems and propose effective solutions based on customer insights and data.  Provide leadership and people management to Engineers, promoting excellence in engineering practices using industry best-practices. Drive improvements to our Engineering practice which ensure we continue to deliver measurable impact as we grow. Create an environment where engineers can deliver consistent, high-quality products. Coach and mentor the team, creating personal and professional development plans to attract and engage top talent. Grow the engineering team by recruiting new engineers who align with the company's strong culture and values. Build strong relationships with all members of the business to actively identify problems and propose solutions based on customer insights and data.   What you bring:  The ideal Engineering Manager will bring a wealth of experience in leading technical teams. They will have demonstrated their ability to motivate their team towards achieving common goals. Their flexibility will allow them to thrive in a constantly evolving environment. Their excellent communication skills will enable them to effectively present ideas and bring people along on the journey. You will be well-organised, able to manage multiple activities concurrently while maintaining focus on key priorities. Your innovative thinking will drive new ideas towards realisation.  Proven experience in building, leading, and motivating technical teams. Strong track record of technical delivery. Significant experience in people management. Flexibility and openness to change within a constantly evolving environment. Excellent oral communication and presentation skills. Ability to manage and prioritise multiple activities concurrently. Ability to bring innovative ideas to the table and drive them towards realisation.   What sets this company apart:  Our client is a fast-moving, highly collaborative and motivated company that is experiencing rapid growth. They have a relentless focus on the customer, delivering great experiences to maintain their high rate of customer referrals. They take a data-driven approach to everything they do, making decisions based on user behaviour and constantly tweaking and optimising to improve. They follow agile practices, delivering improvements iteratively in small chunks. They encourage experimentation with new tools or techniques, and provide opportunities for career growth and progression.  What's next:  Ready to lead an exceptional team towards excellence? Apply now!  Robert Walters endeavours to review all applications in a maximum of five working days. If you have not received correspondence within this timeframe please do not hesitate to contact Henry Deans on +64 4 471 9700.

title: Manager Software Development
description: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Manager of Software Development to establish and lead our new talented team of developers.
jobType: Type: Permanent Hours: Full time Location: Wellington Business Group: Technology Services and Solutions Branch: Organisational Capability and Services Salary: $117,742 - $157,843  As a Manager of Software Development, you'll lead and inspire teams to deliver high-quality software solutions that meet business objectives. Your role involves overseeing the software development lifecycle, from shaping how we plan and design software, to deployment and maintenance. You'll foster a culture of innovation, mentorship, and continuous improvement within your team to drive excellence in software development practices.  Standards & best practices  Leading the software development lifecycle to build and mature it as a practice. Setting strategic goals for the team and establishing development practices to ensure alignment with business objectives and industry best practice. Implementing best practices for version control, including a strategy for repositories, branching, and code review processes to facilitate collaboration and effective management of code changes. Evaluate and select appropriate development tools, frameworks. Establish best practice CI/CD strategies for software releases. Promote the adoption of robust testing practices, including unit testing, integration testing, and automated testing.  Grow our capability  Mentoring team members, providing guidance on technical challenges, and supporting their professional growth and development. Implementing and refining development methodologies such as Agile or DevOps. Leverage DevOps practices and advocate for DevOps principles while bringing your team on the journey with training and hands on experience. Overseeing the recruitment, hiring, and professional growth of the team. Establishing and overseeing coding standards. Encouraging innovation and creativity within the team by fostering a supportive environment for experimentation, exploration of new technologies, and adoption of emerging best practices. Implement security best practices, such as secure coding principles and vulnerability scanning.  Project delivery  Provide input on technical feasibility, resource requirements, and potential risks. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams throughout the software development lifecycle. Assist in the development of estimates for capital bids and business case development.  Applications close: 5pm, Thursday, 19 August, 2024. For more information please contact: Keith O'Dowda, keith.o'dowda@dia.govt.nz Job description: To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website.

title: Asset Information Analyst
description: You will maintain the quality of data within AMIS to support the Asset Management Planning process and other decision making
jobType: Why join us?  Make a Difference: Contribute to the development of Palmerston North City while enjoying a fulfilling career that positively impacts our community Learning and Development Opportunities: Take your career to new heights with Learning and Development opportunities within Palmerston North City Council. Benefits: We do more than just pay you a salary too. We have awesome benefits to support you including 5 weeks annual leave and hybrid working.  About the role  Are you an expert at analytics and data? Are you looking for a role where the information you provide has a direct impact on how things are done?  Our Asset Planning Division is in search of an experienced Asset Information Analyst to maintain and improve Infrastructure asset data. Your experience in analysing data will be useful when ensuring data is converted to information which supports the asset management planning process. Experience with PowerBi, SQL or even C# would be a huge plus along with an understanding of APIs.  In this role youll be working with stakeholders across the Infrastructure Group and beyond, so being able to build and maintain relationships is key.  In return for your skills, we offer a supportive work environment and ongoing development in a city where you really can afford to live and play! If you want to make a real impact on a growing city, put your application in today!  This is a full-time role, 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday.  Your focus in this role will include:  Maintaining, operating and supporting the Asset Management Information System (AMIS). Provide operational support and enable routine analysis and reporting activity across all AMIS. Be the subject matter expert in at least one of the AMIS or asset types. Propose and implement approved changes to improve the management and quality of asset data.  About you  You will need to be a detail-oriented, flexible, and resourceful individual with a strong sense of professionalism.  To excel in this role, you should possess the following skills and experience:  A relevant tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other applicable discipline to a minimum of a Bachelors degree level. 5 years experience in an asset management or infrastructure-related role. Familiarity with data lifecycle management and database management principles. Exposure to managing and maintaining Asset Management Information Systems.  About us  Palmerston North (or as we like to call it, Palmy) is a growing, innovative and exciting city. With small city benefits and big city ambition, Palmy has secured its place on the map as a creative and exciting city, with leading innovation and developments! Were proud to be a city that includes, supports, connects and uses the talents of the whole community in our pursuit to provide a connected and safe community. Were also a future-focused city who cares about enhancing our natural and built environment. Our future looks bright, it looks vibrant and progressive.  What we offer:  Competitive remuneration between $88,870 and $104,553, with a 3% KiwiSaver employer contribution (where eligible) 5 weeks annual leave and a community service day every year Additional long service leave after qualifying periods Parental leave benefits, including paid partner's leave, and top-up payments Hybrid working principles Free access to our on-site fitness equipment Free annual flu vaccinations and subsidised health and eye checks every 2 years Confidential counselling service Waiata group Professional memberships and assistance with study leave and fees Various wellbeing spaces, including parents room and wellness/prayer room; we value our employee experience  Applications close: 11.00 pm, Sunday 18th August 2024  We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and welcome applications from all those suitably qualified for this position.   Job Profile  Please click here to download and view this additional information.

title: Technical Lead (Back-End)
description: Leveraging your expertise in NodeJS, TypeScript, and AWS technologies, you will collaborate with your team to build and enhance information systems.
jobType: The Company:  A thriving and forward-thinking fintech and payments technology company at the forefront of revolutionizing payment platforms and ecosystems. With robust partnerships and a competitive edge in service adoption, they now offer seamless integration solutions and a host of new, world-first features that empower businesses of all sizes to accept diverse payment methods and deliver exceptional customer experiences.  The Opportunity:  They are a growing, listed tech vendor seeking a Technical Lead (Backend) to drive the development of innovative serverless API solutions. Leveraging your expertise in NodeJS, TypeScript, and AWS technologies, you will collaborate with a dynamic team to build and enhance information systems. You will ensure high-quality software delivery aligned with business requirements, embrace challenges as opportunities for growth, and contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and excellence. Their initiatives are wide-ranging, including product development, integration, system/platform/network enhancement, and cyber and vendor engagement and control. With revenue quintupled in the last 24 months, their technology is rapidly being adopted throughout Australasia, with global aspirations on the horizon.  The Fit:  Mandatory Skills, Knowledge, and Experience:  Bachelors degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field, or relevant experience. 5+ years of experience in backend development. Lead and mentor a team of backend developers,fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence. Provide technical guidance and expertise in solving complex problems, both at the code level and system architecture level. Participate in hiring and onboarding processes to build a high-performing backend development team. Proven experience working with cloud services (AWS preferred). Familiarity with both relational and non-relational database systems. Proficiency in testing techniques and tools, including unit tests, integration tests, and E2E tests. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Passionate about technology and its application to deliver value to customers. A problem-solving mindset with the ability to identify and address blockers for team members with compassion and open-mindedness. Desirable Skills, Knowledge, and Experience:  Experience with containerization and orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). Familiarity with serverless frameworks other than AWS SAM (e.g., Serverless Framework, Azure Functions). Proficiency in setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Bitbucket Pipelines, GitLab CI, CircleCI). Experience with monitoring tools (e.g., PagerDuty) and logging solutions (e.g., Datadog). Understanding of DevOps practices, including infrastructure as code (IaC), configuration management, and automated provisioning. Exposure to designing, implementing, and maintaining microservices architectures. Awareness of security best practices in software development. Experience with strategies for scaling and optimizing databases in cloud environments.  This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person. If you're a Senior Software Engineer with mentorship experience looking to step up into a Tech Lead position, send me through your CV as soon as you can.  Please note: Only applications from job seekers who hold a valid work visa, permanent residents, or New Zealand citizens presently based in New Zealand will be considered.

title: Precision Technology Specialist
description: We have an exciting opportunity for a Precision Technology Specialist to join our Corporate Sales Team to cover our Stratford, Masterton and Feilding
jobType: ARE YOU LOOKING FOR THAT NEXT STEP IN YOUR CAREER?    Due to continued growth and expansion, we have an exciting opportunity for a Precision Technology Specialist to join our Corporate Sales Team to cover our Stratford, Masterton and Feildingbranches.  About Us: Brandt is a world-leading equipment dealer, powered by iconic brands and unrivalled support with dealerships across Australia, New Zealand and Canada. Brandts mission is focused on enabling customer success by providing practical and reliable equipment solutions and support. Customers count on Brandt to keep them moving forward, with remarkable customer service and industry-leading brands such as John Deere.  At Brandt we believe great companies are built by great people - and for them. We strive to design a better way to work with employees to help them maximize productivity and achieve their potential. It starts right here with people like you.  About the role:  Promote and sell Brandts range of universal Precision Technology products  Responsible for customer setup, optimisation and training.  Support Sales and Territory Managers to ensure technology is a part of every discussion.  Be the subject matter expert on all demonstrations.  Directly accountable for key KPIs in their territory.  Be the key contact for all customers in your AOR. Success in a sales position,  Aptitude and desire to lead others to achieve the same success,  Strong knowledge of the industry, and the wider agricultural sector,  Proven success creating and maintain healthy profitable customer relationships,  Solid understanding of the financial realities of asset and inventory management, budget management and pricing strategy.  You will also demonstrate a growth mindset and express tangible opportunities to increase market share. title: Technical Support Lead - Wellington
description: The TSL is a versatile "MacGyver" role.
jobType: The Technical Support Lead is a versatile "MacGyver" role responsible for supporting various systems within the Skills Development Group (SDG), Skills Consulting Group (SCG). This role involves hands-on technical tasks such as system administration, configuration, troubleshooting, Continuous improvements and resolving issues across multiple line of business applications.     Your key responsibilities:   Application Support:   Provide first and second-line support for primary business applications in the Skills Development Group (SDG).  Engage with external support agencies/vendors to provide third level support for the above-mentioned applications.  Respond promptly to user inquiries, troubleshoot issues, and communicate solutions directly.  Ensure timely resolution of technical queries across applications like Hubspot, Arlo, Xero, Website CMS, Zoom, Teams, Strigo, Sharefile, and Microsoft Office  Ability to proactively support Zoom, Teams and other key delivery applications for our LiveOnline training delivery, this includes communicating updates and training new facilitators.  Application Configuration and Administration:   Administer and configure business applications.  Stakeholder Communication:   Act as the primary liaison between SDG and D&T teams, including development teams, upper management, and external clients.  Keep all parties informed of system updates, persistent issues, and resolutions.  Technical Expertise:   Develop deep knowledge of HubSpot, Zoom, Arlo, Xero and other core applications.  Stay updated on application features and enhancements.   Business Knowledge and Understanding:   Understand the business, industry standards, and terminology.  Learn related standards/protocols and the structure of business products supported by systems.  Integration Management:   Understand system integrations.  Collaborate with stakeholders for seamless integration and data flow.  Troubleshoot integration-related issues.  Incident Management:   Monitor and respond to incident tickets.  Diagnose and resolve application service disruptions.  Escalate complex issues to appropriate teams when necessary.  Documentation and Reporting:   Maintain accurate records, including logs, progress notes, and incident reports.  Document solutions, workarounds, and best practices.  Generate regular reports on application performance and support activities.  Continuous Improvement and Development:   Collaborate with the Head of D&T Operations and peers to develop and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).  Implement best practices for support objectives.  Participate in process improvement initiatives.  Support any new business initiatives from a D&T perspective to better enable the business.  Contribute to new application assessments for SDG, acting as the SME, working with the wider D&T Team.  SFIA Target level:  Level 4 (Enable): This level indicates a higher degree of autonomy and responsibility. The individual enables others by resolving complex problems, applying diagnostic methods, and technical knowledge to ensure the efficient operation of applications. They may also be involved in proactive maintenance and the implementation of system improvements.      Your qualifications & skills:   Solid understanding of one or more of the applications (Hubspot, Arlo, others)  An ability to pick up and learn about new applications and systems quickly.  You are a self-starter and self-managed.  Familiarity with databases, SQL, and operating systems (e.g., UNIX, Solaris, Windows).   Be inquisitive and curious to understand the underlying business, industry standards and business processes that drive the use of the Student Management systems and other Enterprise Business Systems.  Strong problem-solving abilities to address user inquiries and troubleshoot issues.  Good understanding of technology concepts and how technology components work together to support the business.  Familiarity with system administration, security protocols, and disaster recovery planning, system recovery.  Be customer centric and focused.  Excellent communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.  Demonstrated ability to be able to manage competing priorities and demanding stakeholders.  Ability to analyse complex issues, make informed decisions, and prioritize tasks effectively.  Experience in incident response and crisis management.  Detail-oriented and organised in managing support requests.  Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.  Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.  Relevant certifications (if applicable) in application support or related areas.  Experience delivering training would be an advantage.

title: Solution Architect - Salesforce
description: OSF Digital are seeking experienced Architects to join the NZ team and engage on high profile multi cloud, enterprise level projects.
jobType: OSF Digital is a globally recognised digital transformation specialist. As a trusted Salesforce partner for over a decade, we are experts in B2B, B2C, and multi-cloud solutions. Having just celebrated our 20th anniversary, we're proud of our many accomplishments, including recognition in the Fast Company list of best workplaces for innovators, and in the Salesforce 2023 Partner Innovation Awards for our outstanding Multi-Cloud Digital Transformation expertise.  This role can be based anywhere in New Zealand.  At OSF Digital, youll be able to collaborate with exceptional individuals who are dedicated to delivering quality outcomes. Our diverse team of nearly 2500 professionals operates across 50+ global offices. We foster a strong sense of teamwork, building long-term relationships with our customers.  Key Responsibilities  Providing architecture strategy and design with a focus on Salesforce and its related integrations / technologies Project leadership and client relationship management. Mentor through knowledge sharing and coaching for more junior architects and team members Be a Solution leader responsible for developing end-to-end innovative solutions for complex technical and digital requirements. Engage cross-functionally, own and be responsible for the solutioning, development and documentation of implementations Collaborate with regional/global peers and Portfolios, to deliver high quality solutions.  About You  It would be great to see some of the following in your background:  A genuine passion and knowledge to develop methodologies, tools and best practices to ensure high quality, repeatable processes for the delivery of Salesforce consulting services. Ideally, it would beneficial (not essential) to have strong Public Sector, Sales/Service, Education or Health Cloud knowledge and capability Deep prior experience as a Senior Functional Consultant with the technical aptitude to architect and design complex solutions From eliciting requirements, through to solutions and training, building strong relationships and providing exceptional service A natural desire to learn, eagerness to extend your Salesforce prowess,taking opportunities to lead, coach, mentor and learn from others Keen to show initiative, ownership and autonomy, leading projects with ease and professionalism.  As a Salesforce Platinum Partner, we offer cutting-edge projects. Gain expertise in diverse cloud platforms, including AI, and make a significant difference to clients.Enjoy a flexible work environment with remote options and a positive, supportive company culture. We prioritise work-life balance and well-being initiatives.  Access training, certifications, and career advancement opportunities in our diverse and inclusive workplace. Be valued through awards, and recognition for your contributions.

title: Senior Developer
description: Clever little company cooking up awesome software for employers - cool product, cool team!
jobType: Note for applying: our ATS does not integrate natively with Seek, so please apply through the link provided - not through Seek. Thank you!    About us  PaySauce has been cooking up awesome payroll since 2015. We started off small but have been growing fast - weve moved from start up to scale up and have more and more customers learning to love the Sauce! With our clever platform and our sharp eye for security, compliance and ease of use, we make it really easy for Kiwi employers to manage the human side of business - from contracts to digital timesheets, payroll, banking and filing.  We love payroll and people, and were revolutionising the way they are looked after: we really care about helping both employers and employees by making the tough things simple and letting them focus on the things that matter. Our goal? Effortless yet flexible. Clever solutions that are intuitive to use and make payroll a beautiful experience.    About the role  Our product and reach is growing, which means so is our Development Team. Were looking for confident, capable and clever developers who like the sound of what we do and are keen to help us grow.  Our current stack includes Node.js, MySQL or PostgreSQL (depending on the product), a bespoke framework which the team will be able to help you get a handle on.   About you  Youll already have some development experience in a work environment, so you know what its like working to a delivery schedule. Youll understand collaborating with other departments so we know were on the right track and on the same page with our roadmap and release schedule, and youll understand how to prioritise activities. Youll have deep expertise at multiple levels of the application stack; we don't expect you to know everything, but the more ground you can cover between our presentation layer, integrations, middleware, and backend the better.  Youll be a senior or up-and-coming senior developer with plenty of experience. For us, senior means that beyond your excellent technical knowledge, youll also:  See situations and problems holistically rather than as individual pieces of a puzzle Give guidance and mentorship to uplift the skills of those around you Actively seek out peer review and consultation with others (including other teams) Drill into user needs and requirements, being ready to explore multiple possible solutions to a desired outcome Understand your limitations and where you need to learn a new skillset or seek assistance from others.    Why youll love working at PaySauce  Life is good here with the PayForce. We take care of each other as much as we do our customers: were built on being empathetic, kind, and people first.  We live by ourvalues - they arent just words on a page to us, they are what we live and breathe. Were straight up and take our mission seriously, but we have fun along the way!  Were committed to supporting your development and ensuring you feel fulfilled and happy at work. Were dedicated to ensuringeveryone feels valued and has a contribution to make to PaySauces (very bright) future.  Youll get health insurance, extra leave if youre becoming a parent and an invitation to join our employee share scheme. You can ditch the formal office wear - were pretty laid back, and the office is fun, friendly and close to shops and cafes. Most importantly, youll have an awesome supportive crew around you in a company thats really going places.    Want to apply?  You can apply via the link below - applications will close on Friday the 23rd of August. We cant wait to hear from you!  We'll be interviewing as we go, so we suggest getting your application in nice and early if you're interested.  Our interview process for this role will be:  Informal call Aptitude test Interview  Location: Petone, Wellington  Employment type: Full time (37.5 hours), Permanent    Please apply through our job application form here, not through Seek:  https://www.paysauce.com/careers/apply/

title: Network & Security Engineer (SecOps)
description: Join a company with purpose and mission, make a difference to the lives of millions of people around the world!
jobType: Our client is a leading SaaS company focused on delivering innovative software. Their dynamic team is dedicated to driving continuous improvement and ensuring the security and efficiency of network infrastructure.  The Network and Security Engineer is responsible for ensuring the secure and efficient operation of network infrastructure, systems, and data. By leveraging technical expertise and industry best practices, the Network and Security Engineer will design, implement, and maintain robust network and security architecture, as well as implement proactive security measures to safeguard against potential threats and vulnerabilities. With a focus on continuous improvement, this role aims to optimise networking technology, minimise downtime, and provide a secure, reliable computing environment for the organisation.  Responsibilities  Deploy and manage network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls, Wi-Fi networks, and VPNs. Designing and maintaining networks in Azure. Implement and maintain security controls, protocols, and policies to protect the organisation's network infrastructure, data, and applications for both on-prem and cloud solutions. This includes access controls, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and encryption mechanisms. Conduct regular vulnerability assessments to identify and address security weaknesses in the network infrastructure. Apply appropriate patches, updates, and security fixes to mitigate potential risks. Proactively monitor network performance, analyze logs, and investigate network incidents and outages. Troubleshoot and resolve network-related issues promptly to minimize downtime and optimize network performance. Participate in incident response activities, including investigating and mitigating network and security incidents, conducting post-incident analysis, and implementing preventive measures to enhance network and security resilience and minimize future risks. Stay abreast of the latest network security threats, vulnerabilities, and industry trends. Continuously research and evaluate emerging technologies, tools, and techniques to enhance the organization's network and security posture. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT operations, system administrators, and software engineers. Share knowledge and expertise with team members through documentation, training, and mentoring. Experience & Qualifications: 2-5 years experience in IT, with 2-5 years of IT security experience. A degree in Computer Science or similar is preferred but not required. Understanding of secure network architectures. Experience with Endpoint Protection/Endpoint Detection & Response (EPP/EDR), Security Incident & Event Monitoring (SIEM). Advanced networking knowledge of firewalls, VPNs, routers, switches, and Wi-Fi access points. Proficient in Advanced Threat Protection (ATP), phishing and social engineering, network access controllers (NAC), gateway anti-malware, and enhanced authentication. Experience with incident response and forensic analysis. Experience with vulnerability management and risk mitigations. Strong oral and communication skills. Proof of COVID-19 vaccination required.  If you are passionate about network security and want to be part of a dynamic and innovative team, please submit your resume and cover letter.

title: Intermediate Full Stack Developer
description: Join a supportive, collaborative and experienced team that is making a difference in their field.
jobType: Your new company  We are supporting a start-up with a dynamic team at the forefront of innovative software solutions. With a great company culture, a focus on growth, and an experienced team, they are shaping the future of their area. Flexibility and collaboration are key values as they continue to innovate and make a meaningful impact in their field.     Your new role  As part of the Development team, you'll work with a modern tech stack including React, Node.js, TypeScript, DynamoDB, and AWS. Your responsibilities will include designing and implementing robust features, ensuring the scalability and performance of their applications, and collaborating closely with the team to deliver high-quality software solutions that meet our clients' needs.     What you'll need to succeed   Proficiency in React and Node.js: Strong experience in building and maintaining web applications using React and Node.js.  TypeScript Expertise: Solid understanding and hands-on experience with TypeScript for developing scalable and maintainable code.  Database Knowledge: Experience with DynamoDB or other NoSQL databases.  AWS Experience: Familiarity with AWS services and deploying applications in a cloud environment.  API Integration Skills: Proven ability to design, implement, and integrate APIs.  Problem-Solving Abilities: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to tackle complex technical challenges.  Team Collaboration: Excellent communication and teamwork skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.  Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing requirements.      What you'll get in return   Flexible working conditions  Cutting edge technology in a start-up environment  Professional development and continuous learning opportunities.  A collaborative and inclusive work environment.      What you need to do now     If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV.  If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.   PLEASE NOTE YOU NEED TO BE BASED IN NEW ZEALAND AND HAVE RIGHTS TO WORK IN NZ TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION.

title: Systems Administrator
description: A rare opportunity to join a close-knit, high performing team in a dynamic environment, with exposure to the worlds most prestigious automotive brands
jobType: Who are we?  The Giltrap Group is a proud, family-owned and operated Automotive business with over 50 years of experience in the motoring industry. We are a Great New Zealand company, driven by the love of cars; and we strive to deliver the worlds best automotive journeys and brands. We currently represent 18 of the worlds most prestigious automotive brands across various business disciplines.    Due to a vacancy within our Group Technology team, we are looking for an exceptional individual to join us as a Systems Administrator. You will be joining a close-knit, high performing team in a dynamic environment. To be successful in this role, you will be able to show us a strong technical background and skillset, with a positive, can-do attitude and growth mindset.    What are we looking for?  Strong Microsoft Azure experience - VMs, Power-Bi, Gateways, Data, Integration, Security (Sentinel, Defender), Autopilot, Intune are all going to be well regarded Added points for any exposure to Dynamics 365 General security exposure, expertise and understanding - added points for Sentinel, Defender, DarkTrace, Mimecast Exposure and experience with VMWare, Veeam and Hyper-V Experience with Switching, Routing, Firewalls - configuration, maintenance, support and deployment Experience with hardware, software and various technical issues - showing an ability to troubleshoot analytically and pro-actively Adept at dealing with complex, urgent issues and delivering successful outcomes Works autonomously when needed, but collaborates with the wider Operations/Support/Security/Systems teams when needed Helps upskill, train, mentor and develop our wider teams Has a strong, positive, can-do attitude and its always looking to improve/evolve/upskill in their role and within the business    What is on offer?  Market driven remuneration package Company phone and hardware allowance Modern, premium location in Grey Lynn Flexible working time and structures Group Care and Wellbeing programmes - Physical and mental wellbeing, birthday leave etc.    If you wish to find out more, please reach out - we would love to hear from you if you feel you would be a great fit for our team and this role.    Vacancies within our Group Technology team do not come around often, so this is your opportunity to join a close-knit team who thrive on driving outcomes and helping our Group and Brands succeed. With this in mind, we are looking for someone who stands out from the crowd, is ambitious and has a strong growth mindset and positive attitude to back up your technical expertise.    Visit https://www.giltrap.com/, or visit our GiltrapTV page (https://www.youtube.com/@GiltrapTV/featured) for a taste of what makes us tick and what you will be exposed to in our wider Group.

title: Cloud Architect / Consultant
description: The Cloud Architect / Consultant role is designed to provide top-tier subject matter expertise and strategic advice to our customers.
jobType: Are you an expert Cloud Architect / Consultant with a talent for developing and implementing technical solutions that exceed customer expectations? If you excel at providing top-tier advice, creating high-standard documentation, and fostering strong customer relationships, we have an exciting opportunity for you!  Join a high performing team We are a Remote First Workplace Great company culture with people at its heart A Microsoft Partner with access to training and certification opportunities Permanent, full-time opportunity    About DDS IT  Our culture starts and ends with our people.  We are a successful IT Services business with an eye on the future, having grown to 100+ staff across New Zealand. Our culture starts and ends with our people. We are a growing people-centric team who work with Passion, Energy and Heart to deliver incredible customer experiences. We operate with flexibility and have created a friendly, caring and family feel workplace. You bring your best self to work to fulfil your potential and enable our Vision of connecting people and technology to improve the everyday life of New Zealanders.  At DDS IT we are big enough to partner with some of New Zealands leading Enterprise companies. But were small enough that any one of our clients can pick up the phone and talk to any one of our leadership team. Our size allows easy access to key stakeholders and resources helping remove barriers to create a collaborative environment for share valuable knowledge.  We're growing and truly walk the talk of our values aiming to positively impact individuals both professionally and personally. Our drive for excellence and willingness to go to the ends of the earth for clients has created rapid growth and a loyal customer base.  Our Mission is to become our customers trusted service provider. We believe we will achieve this through increasing the productivity of organisations, through the intelligent use of our products, services, and insights day in and day out.     A little bit about the role  The Cloud Architect / Consultant role is designed to provide top-tier subject matter expertise and strategic advice to our customers. This position involves working through customer specifications to develop tailored solutions that meet defined requirements, whether through designing or implementing technical solutions. The role requires the creation of high-standard documentation and the production of high-quality reports and presentations for senior customer stakeholders.  In this key role, you will conduct customer meetings and workshops, manage customer expectations, and develop strong professional relationships. Additionally, this role involves contributing to intellectual property (IP) development and ensuring repeatability in solutions. By facilitating communication and partnerships across the business, the Cloud Architect / Consultant enables teams to better engage and serve customers. The ultimate goal is to build and promote strong, long-lasting relationships with a diverse range of customers, identifying and exploring new opportunities within both existing and new customer bases.  Your role is pivotal in steering our cloud initiatives, ensuring best practices, and contributing to our cutting-edge solutions.    Key Responsibilities:  Cloud Architecture and Implementation: Develop robust cloud architectures, strategies, and roadmaps. Evaluate and deploy cloud services, ensuring solutions meet stringent performance, security, and availability requirements. Customer Engagement: Conduct customer meetings and workshops, manage expectations, and foster strong professional relationships. Deliver exceptional customer service and act as a trusted advisor. Documentation and Reporting: Author high-standard documentation and produce quality reports and presentations for senior stakeholders. Technical Leadership: Provide technical guidance, participate in disaster recovery planning, and contribute to weekly team meetings. Innovation and Strategy: Streamline and standardize cloud engagements, propose new cloud offerings, and collaborate with the DDS IT teams to bring innovative solutions to market. Engage in market trend analysis and contribute to roadmaps and strategy. Collaboration and Communication: Facilitate communication, partnerships, and cross-pollination across the business to enhance customer engagement and service. Relationship Building: Build and promote strong, long-lasting relationships with a diverse range of customers, identifying and exploring opportunities within both existing and new customer bases.    A bit about you  As a seasoned Cloud Architect / Consultant, you bring over [5] years of hands-on experience, showcasing a proven track record in designing and implementing robust cloud architectures. Your proficiency spans across Microsoft Azure platforms, with a deep understanding of cloud services, infrastructure, and deployment models.    Key Highlights:  Experience in planning and executing cloud migration strategies, including rehosting, refactoring, rearchitecting, and rebuilding applications for the cloud. Strong architectural and design skills, coupled with practical experience in cloud security, compliance, and governance. Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Ansible and Terraform, as well as expertise in observability platforms such as Datadog, Dynatrace, or New Relic. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, essential for seamless teamwork across diverse functions.  Technical Expertise:  Applied knowledge of the Azure Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) & Well-Architected Framework. Proficiency in Azure services, including Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, Azure App Service, Azure Functions, Azure Networking (Virtual Network, Azure Firewall, ExpressRoute), Azure Active Directory, etc Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) and source code management, across systems including Azure DevOps Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes, especially when working with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Proficiency in IaC tools like Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Bicep or Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, for automating infrastructure provisioning and management.  Certifications and Qualifications:  Hold certifications such as Certified Solutions Architect or Azure Solutions Architect.  Solid understanding of the Microsoft environment and application support, with a track record in enterprise-level environments.      Talk to us NOW:  If you thrive in architecting cutting-edge cloud solutions, possess the required certifications, and have a strong background in cloud platforms and services, we invite you to be a key player in shaping the future of DDS IT and Apply Now!  Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume. We are inspired to connect with talented IT professionals and will be holding interviews concurrently with our advertising efforts.  People are at the heart of DDS IT. Excellent culture with a caring and family feel. Now is a once in a lifetime opportunity to join the DDS IT family.  At DDS IT, we strive for excellent HR and Recruitment and Selection standards. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer (EOE) and believe that diversity within the workplace is an essential element to our success.  To know more about us and our open roles, feel free to browse in our DDS IT Careers Page (https://www.ddsit.co.nz/about#careers).

title: Domain Specialist (L2) - Support Office, CCS Planning, Design and Delivery
description: Delivery co-ordination for our Initiatives and Releases. Co-ordination work in various workflow and IKM tools especially JIRA, ServiceNow, SharePoint.
jobType: Provide CCS-PDD delivery co-ordination and support Permanent, full-time role - All Inland Revenue locations considered  M mtou - About us  CCS Planning, Design and Delivery (PD&D) enables high quality design and delivery of integrated change. We work across systems, processes, services and workforce to achieve customer outcomes and benefits. We role model systems thinking and champion good design and innovation within the ecosystem that ensures IR is leveraging its capabilities to improve customer outcomes.  PD&D teams play a key role in planning for, prioritising, designing, scheduling, and implementing changes to systems and related business processes which IR and our customers rely on every day. The changes these teams will be collectively managing may come from policy, legislative (including remedial), technical advice, or procedural adjustments or via updates to functionality by our external suppliers and partners.  M te roopu - About the team  The CCS-PDD Support Office supports delivery planning and quality assurance of CCS-PDD initiatives and Releases, across all delivery phases from design to Early Life Support.  M te tnga - About the role  In this role you will:  Provide Delivery co-ordination expertise for our Initiatives and Releases:  Initiative and Release risk, issues, scope and dependency capture and tracking High level and detailed initiative and Release delivery plans (using JIRA in particular), including block plans Co-ordination work in various workflow and IKM tools especially JIRA, ServiceNow, SharePoint Deployment planning and support Initiative and Release administrative support  Provide Delivery Assurance for our initiatives and Releases:  Creation and updating of Initiative and Release process documentation including templates Initiative and Release risk, issues and dependency assurance Capture, application and implementation of ongoing Lessons Learned Governance Support Adherence to Enterprise delivery standards  Mu - About you  To be successful in this position you will be experienced in:  working in a PMO (Project, Portfolio or Programme management office) type environment project or programme co-ordination.  In your application, please include examples of how you have demonstrated the following three capabilities for the role you are applying for:  Customer Advisory - Provide high quality information, advice and services to internal and external customers by understanding each customer and providing proactive and tailored responsiveness to their needs. Quality Decision Making - Capability to use the right information and insights in the right context, at the right level and pace; making effective decisions considering impacts and independencies. Information Knowledge Management - Capability to develop, manage and secure our knowledge as a key organisational asset; sourcing, capturing, securing, sharing and effectively utilising information.  Tono mai - Apply here  Please apply online, attaching a copy of your CV, Cover Letter and the demonstration of the capabilities required to meet the role requirements. To request a copy of the Role Description or for any questions, please contact Julie.Galang@ird.govt.nz  Applications close at 5pm on Sunday, 11 August 2024.  Inland Revenue welcomes applicants from all walks of life and we want all our people to achieve their full potential. We support flexible working that meets the needs of our people and our business. Let us know if you need any information about the role or any support throughout the recruitment process
fullDescription:

title: Junior Project Manager
description: Ready to dip your toes into Project Management? Play a pivotal role in planning, executing + delivering successful projects at #TeamGallagher.
jobType: About Gallagher  Our purpose at Gallagher is Protect what matters most and we live it every day. Not only does our technology protect some of the worlds highest security environments and agriculture businesses but our purpose also means we care deeply about our people and their families. With operations in New Zealand, Australia, Asia, Africa, USA, Canada, the UK and Europe and exports across the world, we provide our employees unrivalled globally focused career pathways.    The Opportunity  An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Junior Project Manager to play a pivotal role within our Operations team at Gallagher. In this role, youll work closely with the Strategic Operations and Governance Lead to plan, execute and deliver successful projects. Your responsibilities will include managing resources & ensuring projects are completed on time within scope, and on budget. Youll also collaborate with cross-functional teams, lead regular project status meetings, communicate updates, and oversee smooth project handovers and transitions.    The Fit  You might come with previous experience as a Project Manager or have a solid background as an Executive Assistant or similar. Technical skills are also a priority in this role, so advanced literacy in computer applications is key.  Youll also need:  Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications Strong written and verbal communication skills Discretion and confidentiality A bachelors degree or certification is an advantage    Why Gallagher?  At Gallagher, we foster a supportive and family-friendly work environment, where collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement are at the forefront of everything we do. We value work-life balance and prioritise the well-being of our employees. We also offer:  Hybrid working model + when youre in the office youll have free parking, subsidised on-sitecafand great eateries nearby. Life & Disability Insurance. Boost App membership; Gallagher staff discounts at a variety of NZ stores. Plenty of fun along the way; team building events, inspiring guest speakers, and team lunches.   Make a significant impact in Gallagher's Operations team and contribute to the success of our global business. Apply now to become a valued member of #TeamGallagher.

title: Customer Partnership Lead
description: Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in peoples lives
jobType: Our why  Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in peoples lives and help organisations use the power of tech to innovate and grow.  About the role (your why)  Are you ready to elevate your career in a dynamic, senior leadership role? As a Customer Partnership Lead at Datacom, you will be at the helm of managing key accounts, driving strategic growth, and fostering valuable relationships across various customer segments. This role is pivotal in overseeing the entire customer lifecycle, from strategy and growth to sustainability and profitability, ensuring our portfolio thrives.  In this role, you will be assigned clients based on their stage in the sales lifecycle and your unique skill set. You will be responsible for devising and executing strategies that promote growth, sustainability, and profitability for both existing and prospective clients. Ensuring exceptional customer satisfaction is paramount, and you will have significant latitude to shape Datacoms offerings in response to evolving market and customer needs.  This position is perfect for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit, who can leverage extensive executive-level and deep customer relationships to identify and seize future opportunities for Datacom. Join us and be part of a team where your innovative ideas and strategic vision will drive success and make a lasting impact.  What youll bring  Deep business understanding of end-to end sales to delivery cycle Ability to lead and story tell at presentations and confidently sell Datacoms offerings Ability to write high quality proposal documents Strong consultative, strategy and planning skills Financial/commercial/contractual analysis, management, and governance Commercial and Contractual acumen Demonstrated Negotiation skills  Responsibilities  Strategy & Growth:  Strategic planning and execution of acquisition for new customers in your value creation role Focus on new customer acquisition and the exceptional growth (white space) within our existing and new customer portfolio. Net new customers into Datacoms portfolio, that positively contribute to our revenue and margin performance  Relationships:  The Customer Partnerships Lead will have a customer focussed/market facing priority, with the goal to develop long term quality engagements with typically large public and private New Zealand organisations. Building value-based relationships in our accounts whilst developing key relationships (and ecosystems) that strategically enable you to deliver on Datacom objectives  Delivery:  Ensure all delivery is well planned and executed with excellence. Ensuring the right people, commercials and governance are in place to deliver successfully to our customers Consistently and sustainably delivering on commitments made to customers (time, cost, and quality). Managing customer contract issues and resolutions to minimise negative impacts to both Datacom and our customers  Culture and Benefits  Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealands largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.  We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. Youll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment.  Our digital team is very flexible around how we work and fitting work around non-negotiable other commitments is important to us, including when we choose to come to the office.  We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealands largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.  We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported.

title: Project Manager ICT
description: Were looking for an experienced Project Manager to plan, resource, and manage internal ICT and data projects across EECA.
jobType: He angittanga | The opportunity  Were looking for an experienced Project Manager to plan, resource, and manage internal ICT and data projects across EECA, ensuring these are successfully delivered to time, within budget and scope. An initial priority of the role will be implementing a CLM system.    He krero mu | About you  To be successful in this role, youll have:  Experience in Project Management, including managing ICT system and data projects Strong working knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g. Prince2, Agile) The demonstrated ability to get results Ability to work as a collaborative team member across the organisation Experience in managing vendor relationships    Ng huatanga kei a mtou | What we offer  An important opportunity to join a government agency with a strong focus on delivery, to do meaningful work with motivated people that has a tangible impact on the lives of New Zealanders.  Access to a well-utilised social club An excellent working environment  with a dynamic work culture.    M mtou | About us  We are Te Tari Tiaki Pngao  Guardian of the energy.
