Please note: We will be reviewing applications after the closing date and will be in touch as early as possible about status of your application.

title: Customer AI Lead
description: Lead transformative projects but also to become a pivotal part of our AI journey, driving innovations that make a real difference.
jobType: About the role  As the AI Lead at Halter, you will be at the forefront of integrating AI into our customer service operations. This is your chance to lead the development of a world-class Knowledge Management System (KMS) and drive our goal of achieving an 80% resolution rate from AI interactions. You'll oversee the customer content team and ensure seamless AI integration across support, onboarding, and ultimately sales. Join us in doing the coolest AI work in New Zealand today! This is your chance to not only lead transformative projects but also to become a pivotal part of our AI journey, driving innovations that make a real difference.  Who were looking for  Were looking for a unique individual - someone who is very comfortable stepping into a one-of-a-kind role and building it up from scratch. Youll constantly be pushing to the very edge of where you operate, testing new and unique solutions to solve hard problems, and anchoring your decision-making in data. At all times you will have our farmer experience at the core of what you do. The right person for this position will be incredibly collaborative, working cross-functionally to drive a digital-first strategy that operates cohesively within our total customer experience offering. Youll be someone who has experience working in the tech space, and have a keen interest in integrating AI advancements within an organisation. Were open to diverse backgrounds - engineering, research, coding, product, professional services, operations - as long as you are a brilliant doer and thinker with a passion for this work.  What your day could look like  Strategic AI Implementation: Lead the development and implementation of AI strategies for the Customer team, enhancing our KMS to a world-class level. Resolution Rate Optimisation: Drive initiatives to achieve an 80% resolution rate from AI, continuously improving AI models and customer interactions. AI in Customer Support: Integrate AI solutions into our support framework, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our customer service. Onboarding and Sales Integration: Extend AI capabilities to support onboarding processes and sales operations, ensuring a cohesive AI strategy across all customer touchpoints. Team Leadership: Manage and mentor the customer content team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment. Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of AI trends and technologies, implementing the latest advancements to keep Halter at the cutting edge of AI innovation. Pathway to Leadership: This role isnt just about leading AI for our Customer teamits a stepping stone to shaping Halters entire commercial AI strategy. You'll have the opportunity to expand your influence across all aspects of our business, driving AI innovations that revolutionize the agricultural industry. Your success in this role could see you taking the helm of our AI vision, steering Halter to new heights and setting the standard for AI excellence globally.  Why our team loves working at Halter  Every now and again a company comes along that disrupts and transforms an entire industry, leaving society in a better place. Few people get the opportunity to work at companies like these. Halter is an incredible technology transforming an essential industry. We have a genuine and shared connection to our mission to make a difference in the world. Our product changes the lives of our customers, directly improving their livelihoods and their lifestyle. Your work matters. Dedicate yourself to solving real-world problems alongside an epic team in a high-growth culture. The excitement, risk and reward of a high-growth technology scale-up on the global stage. Our ideas are truly valued, we are able to move fast, and our impact is real. State-of-the-art, dog-friendly office thats been thoughtfully designed right in the heart of Auckland city. Healthy body, healthy mind. Were partnered with Southern Cross Health Insurance to support your well-being. We offer 6 months of fully paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 4 weeks of fully paid secondary caregiver leave and many other parental benefits that support you and your family. Our personal growth is important. Halter offers an annual $1000 self-development budget to be used for anything that fuels personal growth. Our time to recharge is valued, were offered wellness leave and unlimited paid annual leave. We offer an inclusive and attractive remuneration package made up of salary, benefits and an employee stock ownership plan. Delicious snacks and drinks are available for your daily flow.  Our Office First Approach  Theres a reason you visit your friends in person, live with your family and dont do dinners over Zoom. Humans are wired for connection. We believe a world-class, in-person office culture is the best way for high-performing teams.  Being office first is a core pillar of our culture. We believe in-person connections are key to driving your own growth, learning, impact, and building genuine long-lasting relationships. Strong relationships make it easier to disagree, give feedback, and do meaningful and aligned work. We dont like having heaps of rules or policies, but this means having strong, trusted relationships is critical.  Were office first, not office only. This means working from the office everyday is our default setting, but we flex when we need to. We have a high-trust culture, so everyone is trusted to do whats best for Halter.  Our office vibe is something special, its hard to describe until youre here, but people at Halter who have come from fully remote or hybrid companies say they could never go back - the high energy and spectacular people they are now surrounded by everyday makes work so enjoyable. Your growth, your learning and your impact is truly unlimited here, and a big part of that comes from being together solving problems, innovating, building context, and constantly learning from each other.  About Halter  The future of food production hinges on an important question: How do we feed the worlds growing population without compromising our natural resources? Farmers feed our population and hold the keys to vital climate solutions. At Halter, were on a mission to enable farmers to run the most productive and sustainable farms. Farmers are using Halter to break free from the time-intensive constraints of conventional farming. Theyre growing more grass, increasing production and improving the health and wellbeing of their cattle.  We bridge deep tech into farming. Halter enables farmers to remotely shift, virtually fence and proactively monitor their cows health and behaviour. Can you imagine watching 500 dairy cows turn in unison and walk calmly towards the milking shed? Or beef cattle, behind virtual fences, happily grazing with their calves? No quad bikes, no dogs, no fences. Just a mob of cows walking at their own pace. People say it looks like magic. Our customers are revolutionizing farming with Halter. It's changing lives and transforming an industry.  People join Halter because they want to do meaningful work. By joining us youll be solving challenging problems within a talented team and a culture built for high performance. Our team out-think, out-work and out-care. Were committed to delivering real change in the world - this isnt easy, and in truth, we love that its hard. Were backed to deliver on a mission that matters by Tier 1 investors includingBessemer Venture Partners,DCVC,Blackbird,Promus Ventures, Rocket Labs Peter Beck andIcehouse ventures.  To find out more, visit our careers website (careersathalter.com), LinkedIn & Instagram (@lifeathalter).  Join our team  Halter is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace  a place where we can each be ourselves and do the best work of our lives. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the requirements, women and under-represented groups of candidates tend to only apply when they meet every requirement. If you think you have what it takes but dont necessarily tick every requirement on this job description, please still get in touch and apply to Halter. Wed love to chat to see if youll be an epic fit!  If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply below by sending through your cover letter explaining why youre excited about this role and working at Halter, along with your CV, and well be in touch!  Please also feel free to check out the careers and culture page (careersathalter.com) for more information on working at Halter and don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram (@lifeathalter).

title: Service Group Owner - Infrastructure Service Delivery
description: The SGO will manage infrastructure project delivery, engage with other parts of technology to ensure resourcing and technology capability are aligned
jobType: M te tranga | About the Role   This role is responsible for ensuring consistency of service delivery across Infrastructure Services & Digital Workplace (ISDW) domains, engaging with other parts of technology to ensure service alignment, and ensuring that Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Operational Level Agreements (OLAs) are consistently met across multiple internal teams and external suppliers. The SGO will manage infrastructure project delivery, engage with other parts of technology to ensure resourcing and technology capability are aligned to meet change initiative requirements and may have people reporting directly to them.  Ownership of how ISDW engages and is engaged with across technology leading creation of a "front door" engagement model for any Change or Critical RUN work. In-depth understanding of all services ISDW provide, along with performance metric reporting across all towers and uplift of IT Service Accreditation (ITSA) scores. Lead specific ISDW refresh projects ensuring consistency and visibility across different towers within ISDW. Service Delivery: Ensure consistency of service delivery across infrastructure domains. This includes managing service level agreements (SLAs) and operational level agreements (OLAs) and ensuring high availability and performance of services. Service Alignment: Engage with other parts of technology to ensure service alignment. This includes coordinating with other teams to ensure that the service is reliable, secure, and efficient. Project Delivery: Manage infrastructure project delivery. This includes overseeing the lifecycle of infrastructure projects, from initiation and planning to execution, monitoring, and closure. Resource Alignment: Engage with other parts of technology to ensure resourcing and technology capability are aligned to meet change initiatives requirements. This includes planning and allocating resources effectively to ensure successful project delivery.  N tu rourou | What will you bring?   Min. 10 years experience in infrastructure service delivery in a leadership role. Expert-level knowledge in infrastructure systems and service delivery. Understanding of services and managing to a service - delivering to business. Familiarity with the latest technologies and trends in infrastructure service delivery and experience in managing the lifecycle of infrastructure projects. Ability to work within tight deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels.    Westpac Hei Whi Mahi | Working at Westpac EDIT ACCORDINGLY FOR FIXED TERM/CASUAL In addition to immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you'll receive some great job perks and benefits including:  4 weeks standard holiday + 5 additional days of wellbeing leave to support you to be your best Additional purchased leave options up to 4 weeks per year Banking benefits, insurance discounts and superannuation scheme Growth and development  we provide opportunities for development and promote internal mobility Recognition - we recognise and reward our star performers School holiday subsidy - help you balance work and family during school holiday 2 Volunteer days per year  Ko mtou tnei | Our Organisation At Westpac, were working together to build a fairer and stronger New Zealand for our people, customers, and communities. For over 160 years weve been driven by our purpose to Create Better Futures Together.  What makes us unique are the incredible people were lucky enough to have walk through our doors every day. The giant W on our building doesnt just stand for Westpac  it says, double you. Were a place that values, rewards and recognises individuality. Where you can be your whole self, your true self, and your best self. Were recognised as a place where talent is developed, where passions are fuelled and where ambitions of all shapes and sizes thrive. And it all starts with you!  Tono mai inianei! | Apply Now!  Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter.  The people of Aotearoa, New Zealand hail from many cultures and backgrounds. At Westpac New Zealand, we draw on this enormous talent pool to cultivate a team rich in ability and empowered to reach its full potential. Our aim is to be brave challengers, celebrating our differences and relentlessly advocating for our customers. It starts with us  we believe that when we care deeply and do our best for our people, theyll do their best for our customers. We encourage people from all walks of life to apply, including those who are neurodiverse, have chronic health conditions or disabilities  your attitude and passion are as important to us as your experience, qualifications and capabilities.  Mahi tahi ttou, kaha ake ttou | Together Greater  Applications close:  19 August 2024

title: Lead/Principal Microsoft D365 Business Central Techno-Functional Specialist
description: Exciting opportunity to demonstrate your hands-on technical and functional knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics NAV/Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
jobType: We are a highly regarded, New Zealand owned technology company. We offer a creative and stimulating work environment and we value and respect inclusivity and diversity.  About this role | M tnei tranga mahi  Our Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central team is seeking a Lead or Principal Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central Consultant. You will be joining one of the most experienced Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Business Central implementation teams in New Zealand who manage many interesting and challenging projects.  As an all-round consultant, you will be able to demonstrate your thorough hands-on technical and functional knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. You also have demonstrated experience having working with the food & beverage industry, and specifically with Aptean F&B. Your overall solid product knowledge and expertise will enable you deliver and implement smart technology and software solutions to our customers. Your extensive experience with solution design and delivering high quality solutions according to set time-lines and budgets will be vital to this key role.  Skills and experience | Ng pkenga me ng wheako  Broad and deep knowledge of all NAV/Business Central modules Experience configuring, developing and delivering Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Business Central software and components in all functional areas Food & beverage industry knowledge, and specifically with Aptean F&B is essential Expert experience assisting with the pre-sales process and providing direction and leadership to project teams Exceptional relationship management, presentation and communication skills are vital Proven experience running workshops Minimum of three years' experience leading a team of at least five consultants Solid C/AL and AL skills and experience with automated testing Comprehensive understanding of the full SDLC is required Solid knowledge of financial management and accounting principles Warehousing and manufacturing experience, including scanning solutions are preferred Food manufacturing and/or warehousing experience, including scanning and integration solutions, is preferable Worked with registered solutions, AppSource apps and older versions of Dynamics NAV Knowledge and experience with Azure DevOps and Power Automate are preferred Experience with a wide range of ISV solutions, preferrable from Tasklet Factory, Insight Works, The Asset Guardian and Continia Excellent analytical and problem solving abilities Team players who are extremely high customer and value to customer focused  About us | M mtou  We have over 25 years of experience as a New Zealand-owned technology consultancy. We take pride in our multicultural and diverse team of 300+ skilled professionals. Our offices are in Auckland, Tauranga, Wellington, and Christchurch.  Working with clients in both the public and private sectors, we strive to deliver innovative solutions and enable smarter outcomes. Our company attracts some of the brightest minds in the industry, as we foster a culture of excellence and continuous learning.  Our values are:  Our people are our greatest asset. We conduct business ethically. Invention, imagination and creativity are the foundation for growth. We work with positive energy, enjoyment, humour and work/life balance. Excellence is our passion and we deliver what we promise  or more! We strive to take a pragmatic approach to all of our activities We value and appreciate our natural environment and seek to play our part to maintain it  Benefits of working at Theta | Ng hua ka puta i te mahi ki Theta  Theta offers a family friendly work environment with flexible work hours where practical; especially relevant for caregivers. We embrace gender equality and are committed to providing a supportive, diverse and inclusive work environment.  Theta is committed to giving back to the community and are avid supporters of Cure Kids. We compete in various adventure races and do many other things to raise money for Cure Kids. And we make time for the fun things in life!  We currently provide the following benefits to ensure your professional development and personal wellbeing:  Professional growth and learning opportunities A competitive salary (commensurate with experience) Hybrid working model Fully subsidised medical insurance for employees Heavily discounted medical insurance for immediate family of employees Enhanced parental leave payment  salary top-ups plus return-to-work incentive Volunteer days Internal Referral Incentive Staff Assistance Programme Annual Flu injections Sick leave from your first day on board Remote working options where practical and mutually agreed Daily fresh fruit basket, coffee machine, wide selection of teas and biscuits in all of our offices. We are also an accredited employer with INZ  Apply now | Tono inianei  Ready to take your career to the next level? We would love to hear from you!

title: Senior Consultant / Developer - D365 & PowerApps
description: Help influence and shape how we do things!
jobType: Voco is a company that:  operates transparently and without internal politics, so that you can do some of the best work of your career because you know whats expected and the role you play in getting there is truly values-led, not profit-led , and as a result, is incredibly successful because when you put people first  employees, contractors and clients  then business success (i.e. profit) happens naturally.  What were looking for  Someone with broad capability across Dynamics 365 (CRM) and Powerapps - and solid experience developing and architecting solutions.   We are a NZ owned tech consultancy and we operate at several different levels within our client organisations. Most of our clients are large enterprises and we develop a variety of bespoke applications for them.  You will have the opportunity to work on a massive variety of work - the types of applications will build vary and the clients we work alongside also vary, so if you're someone who craves new challenges and loads of variety in their work, then we could likely be the place for you!  In a nutshell  You will work alongside our Lead Architect and development team and, depending on your exact skills, you may be leading projects from a technical perspective, or playing a key role as a Senior Developer.  Youll have a proven track record of successfully delivering complex, full life-cycle implementations of D365 & Power Platform in a Solution Architect, Lead Developer, or Senior Consulting role.  A Little About Us  We are Voco.Our name means to have a voice; to express yourself.And this is our promise to all our people  we want you to have a voice because what you think matters, and the work you do matters, and whether you are enjoying the work you do whilst you are working for us, matters. Why? Because youre a human being with hopes and dreams and talent and potential and if we can tap into that then we are well on our way to doing the best work of our lives and having fun along the way.and then our clients will be happyand then theyll come back for moreand so the circle goes. If we look after you, then youll look after our clients and they will look after us. It sure isnt rocket science!  At Voco, we believe that were in this together  all working towards the same goals, with lots of ways to get there, and that its our people who differentiate us from our competitors. And therefore, if each of us has a voice that is actively encouraged and always respected, we will be constantly challenging ourselves and aiming for fresh and new. Not change for changes sake; rather, change for betters sake. Change for simplicitys sake. And this is our very heartbeat  we drive positive change by simplifying the complex.  Our commitment to diversity and inclusioneven more, our commitment to belonging  We believe that all people have equal value, regardless of age, disability status, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion or sexual orientation and we are committed to ensuring that everyone who engages with us  whether as a candidate going through our recruitment process, or as an employee or contractor  experiences true inclusion and the respect they deserve.  We believe that people work in different ways, think in different ways and are motivated by different things and, as a values-based company, what we focus on hiring people who, most importantly, share our values, which are:  Purposefully Restless  this is about being curious and improvement focused. Getting Things Done  this is about having a sense of urgency, a sense of importance and the tenacity to navigate through ambiguity and push past roadblocks. Trusted Powerhouse  this is about being trustworthy and reliable and committed to the goal. People First  this is about working well with others, collaborating, and treating others as you would want to be treated.  We want our people to feel they have found a home with us  somewhere they belong and can be themselves.  We want anyone and everyone to feel confident to connect with us and apply to our vacancies  we will acknowledge all applications  whilst our aim is always to do so within a few days, sometimes it ends up being a bit longer as we are usually working across multiple vacancies at any one time.

title: Senior Mobile Test Engineer - XCUITest and Espresso
description: We are looking for a mobile automation test engineer who is experienced in XCUITest and Espresso.
jobType: M te tranga | About the Role Actively oversee and participate in the delivery and best practice by designing, developing, maintaining, and executing automation/functional test solutions across the WNZL landscape using the most appropriate tool set, and 'best practice' techniques and agile quality engineering practices. Providing thought leadership and peer reviews across the WNZL community in regards to design and implementation of testing strategies & solutions and up-skilling and training of peers regardless of discipline.   N tu rourou | What will you bring?  5 years+ experience in mobile testing using commercial and/or opensource test tools across the testing pyramid Must have Experience with mobile automation: Espresso / Kotlin and XCUITest / Swift Experience with programming languages e.g., Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, C# .etc Strong experience with automation tools, such as Selenium, etc Experience delivering major pieces of work in a complex agile/DevOps delivery environment Practical experience in the design, implementation and execution of test solutions and frameworks Experience in the design, development and implementation of test frameworks and techniques e.g. keyword driven, data driven etc Experience in CI/CD Experience in participating in a quality engineering community Experience in the interpretation of business requirements to determine robust testing scenarios Sound knowledge of systems analysis methods and tools Practical experience with Browserstack Practical experience in Dynatrace / Splunk observability tools Experience with Charles proxy and Analytical tool knowledge   Westpac Hei Whi Mahi | Working at Westpac In addition to immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you'll receive some great job perks and benefits including:  4 weeks standard holiday + 5 additional days of wellbeing leave to support you to be your best  Additional purchased leave options up to 4 weeks per year  Banking benefits, insurance discounts and superannuation scheme  Growth and development  we provide opportunities for development and promote internal mobility  Recognition - we recognise and reward our star performers  School holiday subsidy - help you balance work and family during school holiday  2 Volunteer days per year  Ko mtou tnei | Our Organisation At Westpac, were working together to build a fairer and stronger New Zealand for our people, customers, and communities. For over 160 years weve been driven by our purpose to Create Better Futures Together.  What makes us unique are the incredible people were lucky enough to have walk through our doors every day. The giant W on our building doesnt just stand for Westpac  it says, double you. Were a place that values, rewards and recognises individuality. Where you can be your whole self, your true self, and your best self. Were recognised as a place where talent is developed, where passions are fuelled and where ambitions of all shapes and sizes thrive. And it all starts with you!  Tono mai inianei! | Apply Now!  Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter.  The people of Aotearoa, New Zealand hail from many cultures and backgrounds. At Westpac New Zealand, we draw on this enormous talent pool to cultivate a team rich in ability and empowered to reach its full potential. Our aim is to be brave challengers, celebrating our differences and relentlessly advocating for our customers. It starts with us  we believe that when we care deeply and do our best for our people, theyll do their best for our customers. We encourage people from all walks of life to apply, including those who are neurodiverse, have chronic health conditions or disabilities  your attitude and passion are as important to us as your experience, qualifications and capabilities.  Mahi tahi ttou, kaha ake ttou | Together Greater  Applications close:  18 August 2024

title: Research and Development Engineer
description: Join our innovative team at Chiptech Ltd! Shape your future with exciting projects, growth opportunities, and a vibrant work culture. Apply now!
jobType: The Role:  Reporting to the Research and Development Manager, this senior level position provides a range of exciting technical challenges working on projects to develop products that help keep people independent and safe, along with supporting systems for our manufacturing facility. As we have a wide range of applications and technologies; you should have a willingness to learn and contribute across multiple projects  What we offer:  Great team culture and a competitive salary. Work onsite with a multi-disciplinary team, with free fruit and a great coffee machine, stand-up/sit-down desks, and the opportunity to grow your career while working on life saving products.  Technical Skills:  Embedded programming skills in C, C++, and Python Ability to design and analyse circuits using schematic and PCB design software like Altium Designer, Eagle, or KiCad. Knowledge of embedded systems design and real-time operating systems (RTOS). Experience with using oscilloscopes, multimeters, and logic analysers for testing and troubleshooting hardware. Ability to analyse complex problems and develop effective solutions. Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing industry trends. Ability to think creatively to innovate and improve hardware designs.  Advantages:  Knowledge or experience in RF design. Experience with product testing and certification. Knowledge of fabrication and manufacturing techniques for prototyping and production.  Beneficial Skills:  Familiarity with specific industry standards and regulations related to hardware design (e.g., FCC, CE/UKCA, RED, RoHS). Skills in managing projects, timelines, and resources to meet deadlines and deliverables.

title: Principal Architect - Enterprise Technology
description: Exciting Principal Architect role working across our Enterprise Technology Hub
jobType: Auckland/Wellington based opportunity Banking benefits, health insurance, flexible working options and more Principal Architect role working across our Enterprise Technology Team  This is us. Where making an impact matters.  As a leading banking institution in New Zealand, Kiwibank is dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions and exceptional customer service.  We are currently undergoing a significant transformation program to enhance our capabilities and ensure we stay at the forefront of the industry. We are seeking an experienced Principal Architect to drive the architectural approach across our Enterprise Systems portfolio.  Key Role responsibilities:  Work closely with leaders and teams across different business functions such as HR, Risk, Operations, IT Service Management, Finance, etc., to understand their specific needs and challenges. Develop and maintain the enterprise-wide architecture & roadmap for Enterprise Systems that is aligned with business objectives, industry best practices, and regulatory requirements. Work with Solution Architects to design and implement technology solutions that support the business goals and enhance efficiency and effectiveness of these systems. Review and ensure the quality of all architecture artifacts related to the Enterprise portfolio. Contribute effectively and constructively to the architecture team practice and governance. Provide leadership, coaching, and mentoring to Solution Architects and the wider team resources.  This is us. Where your expertise matters.  Key skills and experience were looking for:  Deep business, architecture, and technical expertise across the Enterprise systems domain including Digital Workplace, IT Service Management, IT Risk Management, IT Operations, HRIS and Finance. Strong stakeholder engagement and business partnering skills, including the ability to influence and persuade at all levels without formal reporting line responsibility for teams. Experience with the deployment of Office 365 and related Microsoft technologies across a large organisation including data security, access controls, and supporting regulatory compliance. Implementation expertise in ServiceNow for enterprise IT Service Management, understanding of ITIL processes and integrating ServiceNow with other enterprise systems like O365. Experience maintaining highly effective relationships with partners and suppliers. Pragmatic, reliable, and able to work under pressure and tight timelines.  This is us. Where you and your whnau matter.  We want you to get the most out of work and life, so you will have the option to explore flexible working arrangements that suit both your needs and ours. We now also offer one wellbeing day a quarter to ensure our people are taken care of and can bring their best selves to work. Our great range of benefits include health and life cover, discounted banking, insurance products and an incredible package for new parents.  We are proud to be a certified B Corporation and we are the first bank in Aotearoa to get the Gender Tick. We are also an accredited Living Wage employer.  Apply Now!  We will be reviewing applications throughout the advertising period, and we reserve the right to withdraw the ad at any time. Applications close Monday 19th August.  At Kiwibank we are all about making Kiwi better off  For an idea about what life is like at Kiwibank and some of the benefits we offer make sure to check out the attached video.

title: Technical Customer Support (Int - Snr) for an AI Powered Startup Saving Lives!
description: Join our fast-growing AI startup and help revolutionise workplace safety! Solve exciting tech challenges and grow with us.
jobType: About Us:  At inviol, were a dynamic startup on a mission to transform workplace safety through cutting-edge AI technology. Our innovative solutions are making a real impact across industries, and were growing rapidly.  As part of our team, youll be at the forefront of a thrilling journey, working with advanced AI systems to create safer work environments. If youre passionate about technology and looking for an exciting role in a fast-paced startup, this is the perfect opportunity for you.  The Opportunity:  As a Technical Customer Support Specialist, youll play a crucial role in our customer journey. From onboarding new clients to troubleshooting technical issues, youll be the bridge between our cutting-edge technology and our customers. Youll work closely with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring seamless integration and exceptional customer experiences.  Key Responsibilities:  Customer Communication: Interact with customers, including IT teams, installers, and end-users, to provide support and gather necessary information. Provisioning & Configuration: Manage the provisioning of Linux-based hardware, configure edge AI devices using Ubuntu, bash, and SSH, and ensure all setups are completed on schedule. Onboarding & Support: Oversee the technical onboarding process for new customers, ensuring a smooth transition and timely activation of services. Issue Resolution: Handle technical support tickets, diagnose and resolve issues on deployed hardware, and strive to meet SLAs and response time targets. Feature Assistance: Help non-technical users find features, change settings, or navigate our app to ensure they can fully utilise our platform. Workflow Management: Maintain and improve our onboarding and support workflows, looking for opportunities to automate processes and enhance efficiency. Collaboration: Work closely with both our engineering and customer support teams to deliver comprehensive solutions.  Who Were Looking For:  Technical Expertise: Strong understanding of networking, RTSP feeds, Docker, security cameras, Ubuntu, bash, and SSH. This is a must, please do not apply if you are not familiar with most of these technologies. Exceptional Communication: Fluent in English with excellent communication skills. Capable of communicating effectively with both technical and non-technical team members and customers. Onsite Work: Is able and is keen to work in the office with the team on a regular basis. Perfectionist & Detail-Oriented: A meticulous approach to work, ensuring every task is completed to the highest standard. Problem Solver: Naturally inclined to solve problems and find efficient solutions, with a strong attention to detail. Task-Oriented: Enjoys working through lists, completing tasks, and ensuring projects are finished on time. Self-Motivated: Driven to deliver high-quality results and meet deadlines without constant supervision. Go-Getter: Motivated to go the extra mile in a startup environment. This isnt always your typical 9-5 but is an exciting and dynamic role that requires flexibility and a proactive approach.  Why Join inviol?  Impact: Be part of a company making a tangible difference in workplace safety. Growth: Join a fast-growing startup with opportunities for professional development. Innovation: Work with cutting-edge technology and a team of experts in AI and machine learning. Environment: Enjoy a dynamic, high-energy and hard-working startup environment.  Ready to Make an Impact?  If youre passionate about technology and customer service and eager to join a team thats making a real difference, wed love to hear from you. Please submit your CV and a cover letter detailing why youre the perfect fit for this role.

title: Systems Architect
description: Systems Architect to architect and maintain the technical vision within the Agile Release Train (ART).
jobType: The Company Our client is a government entity that fosters a collaborative, agile environment, driving continuous innovation and strategic excellence. This position ensures that all developed solutions align with the overarching architectural strategy, supporting agile development and facilitating efficient value delivery within the technology department.  Key Responsibilities  Define and maintain the technical architecture runway within the Agile Release Train (ART). Collaborate with the Product Manager and Release Train Engineer on strategic investment decisions. Manage and prioritize technical debt and risk items. Clearly communicate the technical vision and strategy for the ART. Provide technical guidance and support to Agile teams. Actively participate in ART events such as PI Planning and System Demos. Outcomes  Successfully lead and contribute to the Agile Release Train (ART), ensuring technical stability, scalability, and efficiency. Foster a continuous delivery and innovation environment within an Agile framework. Drive strategic decisions and prioritization, aligning investments with organizational goals and value outcomes. Effectively manage and resolve technical debt and risks, optimizing the ARTs technical health. Ensure all solutions align with the architectural strategy and technical vision. Enhance agility and innovation within Agile teams, promoting effective collaboration and communication. Key Skills  Expertise in systems architecture and technical strategy. Proficiency in Agile methodologies and frameworks. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Ability to analyze complex problems and develop innovative solutions. Excellent documentation and technical writing skills. Skilled in assessing and mitigating architectural risks, ensuring alignment with business goals.  On offer is a company that prides themselves on inclusivity, diversity and a family first culture. They offer a competitivesalary package and flexible working. If you are looking for a new challenge and are on the hunt for a new role, please apply today.

title: Kaittari Hua Rautaki Strategic Asset Analyst
description: Contribute to a future focused Asset Management Plan. Present insights and support decision making across Z. Hybrid working, WFH and office.
jobType: Company Description  Z has a clear purpose: Powering better journeys, today and tomorrow. As one of New Zealands largest transport energy companies, we have a commitment to delivering safe, secure, and reliable transport energy  with the opportunity to deliver new journeys, with new energy solutions in a changing world.  We are proud to be the Kiwi contingent in the Ampol Group, an independent Trans-Tasman energy company, with trading offices across the globe, which are united behind our shared purpose. While many of the challenges and opportunities we face go beyond national boundaries, together we have the scale, influence, and capability to deliver for our customers, communities, and our people.  Job Description  Our Supply team are the team that fuels our customers, literally! Supply at Z Energy looks after the whole fuel supply chain and maintenance of all assets to ensure we have what we need, where we need it.  Here at Z we love to develop and grow our people!Due to an internal move we are looking for a Kaittari Hua Rautaki Strategic Asset Analyst to join our Assets team and support the development of a fit for purpose and future focused Asset Management Plan.  Using your knowledge and expertise in data and insights you will present Asset Management options that allow Z to enhance the optimisation of our operating assets. If you are looking for a role where you will work within teams of experts and use your analytics skills and experience to shape the conversations for long term infrastructure investment critical to New Zealands economy we would love to hear from you!  You will have the opportunity to  Work across Z Assets and Z Digital teams to ensure we have the data and support systems to gain insight and inform asset decisions Guide the analysis of our asset performance, risk and costs to contribute to asset management plans and decision making Work as the point of contact in the Assets team for data and information needs and queries Manage asset information and contribute to the development of long term asset investment plans Develop and improve systems and procedures and Enjoy our Agile Ways of Working to contribute to a variety of initiatives Qualifications  What youll bring to Z  Demonstrated experience in data analysis including investigating and highlighting trends, presenting, and reporting on results and providing conclusions and recommendations The ability to adapt to a range of datasets and at times work with ambiguity Experience with asset management would be advantageous Strong technical skills in PowerBI and Excel Great presentations skills of data, using tools to visualise information, provide insights and support decision making to a range of audiences A real drive to deliver results, drive change and make a positive contribution within a team  And of course, youll be passionate about what matters to Z, embracing and living our valuesto helpus deliver on our aspirations and broader commitment to Aotearoa New Zealand.  Dont meet every single requirement? At Z we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if youre excited about this role but your past experience doesnt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.  Additional Information  What we can offer you  A competitive remuneration package including short-term incentive plan, medical insurance for you and your family, enhanced employer contribution for KiwiSaver Generous leave provisions including enhanced sick leave, parental leave benefits and the option to buy additional leave The balance of hybrid working, enjoy some of your week at home and some in our welcoming office space The opportunity to contribute and be part of a supportive team that is here to make a difference A chance to build your own capability through learning from some of the industrys most knowledgeable people who have a desire to share their insights along with access to upskilling opportunities and career development across the organisation Two days a year to do Good in your Hood, though our volunteering scheme, a chance for you to help others in your community in a meaningful way to you  The base salary range for this role is $96,900 to $114,000 per annum, plus 15% STI based on company performance, a 5% KiwiSaver employer contribution and health insurance through Southern Cross.   Why Z?  Z has always been a proud Kiwi company. Were aspirational for our future, confident of our role in Aotearoa New Zealands success and deeply loyal to our customers, communities and people.  At Z we focus on achieving extraordinary outcomes by setting the appropriate context, rather than by telling our people what to do. By doing this, high performing and talented people deliverbetter results and are more personally fulfilled.  We care deeply for our people while pushing them to achieve their best as individuals and collectively as an organisation. Our flexible working approach and Rainbow Tick and Gender Tick accreditations - backed by our strong company values, T Kaha Stand Up, T Maia Speak Out, T Kotahi Side by Side - have created an open and inclusive workplace that promotes personal development and is underpinned by a desire for our people and our communities to succeed.  One of the things we stand for at Z is Diversity & Inclusion. It is our belief that having a diverse workforce make it possible for our people to truly be themselves and deliver on our aspirations for Z.  Were distinctive in our approach and if youre up for a challenge, wed love you to be part of it. If Z sounds like a place you believe you can add value and grow your own capability, then make sure you read Our Why. This is our founding document and provides further insights in what it means to part of the Z whnau.  If Z feels like a good match for your head and your heart, come join us for one heck of a journey!  Whakauru | Apply  Please include a cover letter in your application, telling us why youre a great fit for Z.  Applications close:Tuesday 20th August 2024  Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw the advertising at any time.  To be considered for this position you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.

title: Customer AI Lead
description: Lead transformative projects but also to become a pivotal part of our AI journey, driving innovations that make a real difference.
jobType: About the role  As the AI Lead at Halter, you will be at the forefront of integrating AI into our customer service operations. This is your chance to lead the development of a world-class Knowledge Management System (KMS) and drive our goal of achieving an 80% resolution rate from AI interactions. You'll oversee the customer content team and ensure seamless AI integration across support, onboarding, and ultimately sales. Join us in doing the coolest AI work in New Zealand today! This is your chance to not only lead transformative projects but also to become a pivotal part of our AI journey, driving innovations that make a real difference.  Who were looking for  Were looking for a unique individual - someone who is very comfortable stepping into a one-of-a-kind role and building it up from scratch. Youll constantly be pushing to the very edge of where you operate, testing new and unique solutions to solve hard problems, and anchoring your decision-making in data. At all times you will have our farmer experience at the core of what you do. The right person for this position will be incredibly collaborative, working cross-functionally to drive a digital-first strategy that operates cohesively within our total customer experience offering. Youll be someone who has experience working in the tech space, and have a keen interest in integrating AI advancements within an organisation. Were open to diverse backgrounds - engineering, research, coding, product, professional services, operations - as long as you are a brilliant doer and thinker with a passion for this work.  What your day could look like  Strategic AI Implementation: Lead the development and implementation of AI strategies for the Customer team, enhancing our KMS to a world-class level. Resolution Rate Optimisation: Drive initiatives to achieve an 80% resolution rate from AI, continuously improving AI models and customer interactions. AI in Customer Support: Integrate AI solutions into our support framework, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our customer service. Onboarding and Sales Integration: Extend AI capabilities to support onboarding processes and sales operations, ensuring a cohesive AI strategy across all customer touchpoints. Team Leadership: Manage and mentor the customer content team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment. Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of AI trends and technologies, implementing the latest advancements to keep Halter at the cutting edge of AI innovation. Pathway to Leadership: This role isnt just about leading AI for our Customer teamits a stepping stone to shaping Halters entire commercial AI strategy. You'll have the opportunity to expand your influence across all aspects of our business, driving AI innovations that revolutionize the agricultural industry. Your success in this role could see you taking the helm of our AI vision, steering Halter to new heights and setting the standard for AI excellence globally.  Why our team loves working at Halter  Every now and again a company comes along that disrupts and transforms an entire industry, leaving society in a better place. Few people get the opportunity to work at companies like these. Halter is an incredible technology transforming an essential industry. We have a genuine and shared connection to our mission to make a difference in the world. Our product changes the lives of our customers, directly improving their livelihoods and their lifestyle. Your work matters. Dedicate yourself to solving real-world problems alongside an epic team in a high-growth culture. The excitement, risk and reward of a high-growth technology scale-up on the global stage. Our ideas are truly valued, we are able to move fast, and our impact is real. State-of-the-art, dog-friendly office thats been thoughtfully designed right in the heart of Auckland city. Healthy body, healthy mind. Were partnered with Southern Cross Health Insurance to support your well-being. We offer 6 months of fully paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 4 weeks of fully paid secondary caregiver leave and many other parental benefits that support you and your family. Our personal growth is important. Halter offers an annual $1000 self-development budget to be used for anything that fuels personal growth. Our time to recharge is valued, were offered wellness leave and unlimited paid annual leave. We offer an inclusive and attractive remuneration package made up of salary, benefits and an employee stock ownership plan. Delicious snacks and drinks are available for your daily flow.  Our Office First Approach  Theres a reason you visit your friends in person, live with your family and dont do dinners over Zoom. Humans are wired for connection. We believe a world-class, in-person office culture is the best way for high-performing teams.  Being office first is a core pillar of our culture. We believe in-person connections are key to driving your own growth, learning, impact, and building genuine long-lasting relationships. Strong relationships make it easier to disagree, give feedback, and do meaningful and aligned work. We dont like having heaps of rules or policies, but this means having strong, trusted relationships is critical.  Were office first, not office only. This means working from the office everyday is our default setting, but we flex when we need to. We have a high-trust culture, so everyone is trusted to do whats best for Halter.  Our office vibe is something special, its hard to describe until youre here, but people at Halter who have come from fully remote or hybrid companies say they could never go back - the high energy and spectacular people they are now surrounded by everyday makes work so enjoyable. Your growth, your learning and your impact is truly unlimited here, and a big part of that comes from being together solving problems, innovating, building context, and constantly learning from each other.  About Halter  The future of food production hinges on an important question: How do we feed the worlds growing population without compromising our natural resources? Farmers feed our population and hold the keys to vital climate solutions. At Halter, were on a mission to enable farmers to run the most productive and sustainable farms. Farmers are using Halter to break free from the time-intensive constraints of conventional farming. Theyre growing more grass, increasing production and improving the health and wellbeing of their cattle.  We bridge deep tech into farming. Halter enables farmers to remotely shift, virtually fence and proactively monitor their cows health and behaviour. Can you imagine watching 500 dairy cows turn in unison and walk calmly towards the milking shed? Or beef cattle, behind virtual fences, happily grazing with their calves? No quad bikes, no dogs, no fences. Just a mob of cows walking at their own pace. People say it looks like magic. Our customers are revolutionizing farming with Halter. It's changing lives and transforming an industry.  People join Halter because they want to do meaningful work. By joining us youll be solving challenging problems within a talented team and a culture built for high performance. Our team out-think, out-work and out-care. Were committed to delivering real change in the world - this isnt easy, and in truth, we love that its hard. Were backed to deliver on a mission that matters by Tier 1 investors includingBessemer Venture Partners,DCVC,Blackbird,Promus Ventures, Rocket Labs Peter Beck andIcehouse ventures.  To find out more, visit our careers website (careersathalter.com), LinkedIn & Instagram (@lifeathalter).  Join our team  Halter is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace  a place where we can each be ourselves and do the best work of our lives. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the requirements, women and under-represented groups of candidates tend to only apply when they meet every requirement. If you think you have what it takes but dont necessarily tick every requirement on this job description, please still get in touch and apply to Halter. Wed love to chat to see if youll be an epic fit!  If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply below by sending through your cover letter explaining why youre excited about this role and working at Halter, along with your CV, and well be in touch!  Please also feel free to check out the careers and culture page (careersathalter.com) for more information on working at Halter and don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram (@lifeathalter).

title: Senior Project Manager
description: Experienced Service Management Project Manager role, either permanent or contract considered.
jobType: About Us  Service Dynamics is a leading provider of enterprise service management solutions, specialising in implementing and supporting ServiceNow, Atlassian, HaloITSM, and Ivanti products. 100% locally owned, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service and support at realistic New Zealand prices. Our clients include New Zealand Government agencies, large enterprises, and SMEs nationwide.  Role Overview  We seek an experienced and dynamic Senior Project Manager to join our team. In this role, you will lead and manage the delivery of enterprise service management projects, ensuring that our clients achieve seamless IT operations. You will work closely with our clients and internal teams to deliver tailored solutions, with a strong focus on Atlassian, ServiceNow and HaloITSM.  Key Responsibilities  Lead and manage end-to-end project delivery, ensuring projects are completed on time, within scope, and within budget. Develop and maintain project plans, schedules, and budgets, while proactively managing risks and issues. Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements and tailor solutions to meet their specific needs. Oversee project teams, providing guidance and support to ensure successful delivery. Ensure clear communication with all stakeholders, including clients, team members, and senior management. Drive continuous improvement by identifying and implementing best practices and process enhancements. Manage project scope changes and client expectations effectively. Prepare and present project status reports and updates to stakeholders.  Key Requirements  More than 5 years of experience in project management, with a proven track record of delivering successful projects. Experience delivering service management solutions, specifically with Atlassian and HaloITSM. Strong understanding of enterprise service management practices and methodologies. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and build strong client relationships. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically. Relevant project management certifications (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2). Can work in both Agile and hybrid delivery methodologies.  What We Offer  Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work with a locally owned company with a strong reputation in the industry. Supportive and dynamic work environment. Opportunities for professional growth and development. Hybrid and flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance. Life and trauma insurance plus a HealthNow allowance.

title: Governance, Risk, and Compliance Analyst
description: Provide a pragmatic & risk-managed approach to cyber security to ensure that Gallaghers technology environments are secure, compliant & resilient.
jobType: About Gallagher  Our purpose at Gallagher is Protect what matters most and we live it every day. Not only does our technology protect some of the worlds highest security environments and agriculture businesses but our purpose also means we care deeply about our people and their families. With operations in New Zealand, Australia, Asia, Africa, USA, Canada, the UK and Europe and exports across the world, we provide our employees unrivalled globally focused career pathways.    The Opportunity  As a Governance, Risk, and Compliance Analyst at Gallagher, you'll be an integral part of our Information Security team. Your role is to assess and manage risks related to our technology systems and infrastructure. You'll perform technical assessments, identify risk mitigation measures, and ensure compliance with audit requirements. Additionally, you'll document and communicate risks, prepare reports, and collaborate with stakeholders to enhance our cybersecurity resilience. This position requires a pragmatic approach to cybersecurity and the ability to provide robust recommendations to ensure our technology environments remain secure, compliant, and resilient.    The Fit  Were looking for a proactive, detail-oriented professional with experience in the IT industry, including in a Governance, Risk, and Compliance role. You should have:  A working experience of cyber risks and threats and how best to manage them. Understanding of the NZISM Experience with ISO27001 and SOC2  Inaddition,youllpossess excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Your ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment, manage complex tasks, and drive continuous improvement will be crucial.The following industry certification will be an advantage OCEG: GRCP, ISC2: CGRC, ISACA: CRISC    Why Gallagher?  At Gallagher, we foster a supportive and family-friendly work environment, where collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement are at the forefront of everything we do. We value work-life balance and prioritise the well-being of our employees.We also offer:  Hybrid working model + when youre in the office youll have free parking, subsidised on-sitecafand great eateries nearby.  Retirement plan contributionup to 5% (on top). Life & Disability Insurance.  Boost App membership; Gallagher staff discounts at a variety of NZ stores.  Plenty of fun along the way; team building events, inspiring guest speakers, and team lunches.    Make a significant impact in Gallagher's IS team and contribute to the success of our global business. Apply now to become a valued member of #TeamGallagher.

title: Consultant
description: TTC is seeking exceptional Consultants across New Zealand to be part of our dynamic growth journey.
jobType: The Organisation  TTC is a NZ owned, operated and internationally awarded QA/testing practice which works with leading 'tier one' firms across NZ, Australia, Asia, Europe and the US. Were in an exciting space which continues to go from strength to strength. TTC teams are smart and engaging and collaborate globally to solve important and challenging problems.    The Role  We are looking for an experienced Consultants who will be responsible for delivering professional testing services to TTC clients. This role applies to all testing services offered by TTC including (but not limited to):  Development and execution of functional testing (UI, API and Database) Particular experience with testing SAP and other ERPs, and working closely with users for facilitate UAT  The Consultant can seamlessly transition between traditional and agile project methodologies. Excels in leadership and mentoring, offering invaluable guidance to both TTC and client teams. Has extensive experience across various industries and application technologies. Has done roles demonstrating professional test methodologies and principles, applied functional test automation.  Note we are looking for Consultants across New Zealand.  The Responsibilities  Review functional and non-functional requirements and specifications Display energy and drive that ensures the achievement of individual and teamwork goals Lead and support testing activities and test infrastructure Ensure assigned work is achieved within the agreed timeframes and visible to stakeholders Work and consult with our clients across project implementation and test phases Analyse requirements and create test scripts and requirements traceability Plan and execute tests Apply testing methodologies and principles to execute non-UI and automated test cases Use tools to increase efficiency of testing including automation execution, provisioning of data and generation of test data Identify, analyse and manage defects Build and deliver a robust regression test suite Provide leadership, technical support and consulting for the wider test team Provide progress reporting as required    Your Experience & Skills  5  10 years hands on experience and exposure to all types of testing Experience operating in Senior Test Analyst/Engineer roles. Test Lead experience an advantage but not a requirement Strong technical skills essential, must be able to analyse and understand technically diverse application architectures Excellent analytical skills essential, must be able to identify areas of non-functional risk within an application and design an appropriately comprehensive test strategy Firm grasp on the aspects of an automation test methodology Experience with a variety of platforms e.g. client/server Extensive experience in the ICT industry Strong knowledge of SQL databases Experience with SAP or other ERPs required    Your Qualifications  Bachelors degree in computer science, engineering or similar is desirable. ISTQB Certified ideal, but not essential.    The Extras We Look For  In addition, to the above experience, we are seeking someone who are: Fast Learners. We like to stay on the cutting edge of software development and software testing so there is always something new to learn to help our customers out! Jugglers. You will have demonstrated an ability to support multiple simultaneous activities and be comfortable and flexible in moving from one deliverable to another at the drop of a hat. Team Players. You will appreciate the importance of working as part of a larger test team and will bring exceptional interpersonal and communication skills that ensure you bring value from day one!   If you think this role is something that excites you, we would love to hear from you. In return we can offer you a hugely supportive culture where our teams genuinely enjoy coming to work each day.   So if you think this is you, throw your hat in the ring now by hitting the Apply option so that we can review your suitability and overall 'fit'.

Utilities rebate for home costs like power and fibre. One day per year for community volunteering. One wellbeing leave day every six months. Parental leave benefits, including 100% salary top-up. title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Innovate, collaborate, and grow as a Senior Software Engineer at Motion Design based in Waikato Innovation Park. Apply today!
jobType: About Motion Design  Motion Design is a leading New Zealand-owned company specialising in custom automation and software solutions. With over 25 years in business, we deliver innovative and bespoke systems tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients across various industries.  We opened our Hamilton office over 11 years ago with a team of three, serving two key clients. We now have a team of seven and have grown that customer base substantially, with good reason to believe that further growth is possible. As such, we are needing to expand our software team and their capabilities.  This role is for our Hamilton software office which is located at Waikato Innovation Park near the University. Candidates are expected to be in or near Hamilton and primarily work in the office, however working from home is available from time to time as needed.  Who we are looking for  We are looking for a senior team member who has all of the hands-on software experience you would expect from a Senior Software Engineer, but also has the people skills to help with visiting new and existing clients, managing projects and providing design input for new projects.  If you think you'd be a great fit for the role but dont have the exact experience set out below, please still get in touch and apply  wed love to hear from you!  To enjoy and excel in this role were looking for:  Extensive knowledge of server-side, front-end and databases  we use Spring Boot, Kotlin, React/Typescript and MySQL/PostgreSQL running on Linux. Extensive experience in software architecture, UI Design, coding, and debugging software, VM/Linux support. Strong English communicator who thrives in a collaborative environment. Someone confident in assisting with sales activities by building customer relationships, visiting new clients in-person to promote our services and get projects over the line. Proven leadership qualities with experience in mentoring, training, and project management. Attending team meetings to discuss projects, brainstorm ideas and put forward solutions to any issues.  Bonus Points:  Experience with SaaS architecture or SaaS systems. Experience with any robot or hardware integration. What youll be doing  As a team, we share responsibility for the whole project life-cycle: design, implementation, testing/review, deployment and operations. When needed, we work on tasks outside of our specialist areas, and you need to be willing to contribute as required.  You will:  Write code that is understandable, robust, and high-performing; Collaborate on multiple projects with other members of the Hamilton team; Perform code reviews and quality assurance testing; Visit new and existing clients to discuss new projects ideas and provide solutions with the client; Create proposals for new projects, fleshing out specifications and requirements while also pricing them up; Stay on top of technology developments and actively teach and learn from colleagues; and Influence the future direction by contributing ideas, providing feedback, and evaluating options for the team. Why Motion Design? Work on a wide range of challenging and rewarding projects. Collaborative and supportive work environment that fosters learning and growth with a talented and experienced team. Be part of a company committed to innovation and making a real impact via helping customers succeed with technology. Great location - Waikato Innovation Park with on site cafe and gym.  To qualify for this role you must be a NZ Citizen or Permanent Resident.  Please submit your CV and a cover letter via Seek, stating your motivation for this position.  Apply Now!

title: Lead/Principal Microsoft D365 Business Central Techno-Functional Specialist
description: Exciting opportunity to demonstrate your hands-on technical and functional knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics NAV/Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
jobType: We are a highly regarded, New Zealand owned technology company. We offer a creative and stimulating work environment and we value and respect inclusivity and diversity.  About this role | M tnei tranga mahi  Our Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central team is seeking a Lead or Principal Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central Consultant. You will be joining one of the most experienced Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Business Central implementation teams in New Zealand who manage many interesting and challenging projects.  As an all-round consultant, you will be able to demonstrate your thorough hands-on technical and functional knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. You also have demonstrated experience having working with the food & beverage industry, and specifically with Aptean F&B.Your overall solid product knowledge and expertise will enable you deliver and implement smart technology and software solutions to our customers. Your extensive experience with solution design and delivering high quality solutions according to set time-lines and budgets will be vital to this key role.  Skills and experience | Ng pkenga me ng wheako  Broad and deep knowledge of all NAV/Business Central modules Experience configuring, developing and delivering Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Business Central software and components in all functional areas Food & beverage industry knowledge, and specifically with Aptean F&B is essential Expert experience assisting with the pre-sales process and providing direction and leadership to project teams Exceptional relationship management, presentation and communication skills are vital Proven experience running workshops Minimum of three years' experience leading a team of at least five consultants Solid C/AL and AL skills and experience with automated testing Comprehensive understanding of the full SDLC is required Solid knowledge of financial management and accounting principles Warehousing and manufacturing experience, including scanning solutions are preferred Food manufacturing and/or warehousing experience, including scanning and integration solutions, is preferable Worked with registered solutions, AppSource apps and older versions of Dynamics NAV Knowledge and experience with Azure DevOps and Power Automate are preferred Experience with a wide range of ISV solutions, preferrable from Tasklet Factory, Insight Works, The Asset Guardian and Continia Excellent analytical and problem solving abilities Team players who are extremely high customer and value to customer focused  About us | M mtou  We have over 25 years of experience as a New Zealand-owned technology consultancy. We take pride in our multicultural and diverse team of 300+ skilled professionals. Our offices are in Auckland, Tauranga, Wellington, and Christchurch.  Working with clients in both the public and private sectors, we strive to deliver innovative solutions and enable smarter outcomes. Our company attracts some of the brightest minds in the industry, as we foster a culture of excellence and continuous learning.  Our values are:  Our people are our greatest asset. We conduct business ethically. Invention, imagination and creativity are the foundation for growth. We work with positive energy, enjoyment, humour and work/life balance. Excellence is our passion and we deliver what we promise  or more! We strive to take a pragmatic approach to all of our activities We value and appreciate our natural environment and seek to play our part to maintain it  Benefits of working at Theta | Ng hua ka puta i te mahi ki Theta  Theta offers a family friendly work environment with flexible work hours where practical; especially relevant for caregivers. We embrace gender equality and are committed to providing a supportive, diverse and inclusive work environment.  Theta is committed to giving back to the community and are avid supporters of Cure Kids. We compete in various adventure races and do many other things to raise money for Cure Kids. And we make time for the fun things in life!  We currently provide the following benefits to ensure your professional development and personal wellbeing:  Professional growth and learning opportunities A competitive salary (commensurate with experience) Hybrid working model Fully subsidised medical insurance for employees Heavily discounted medical insurance for immediate family of employees Enhanced parental leave payment  salary top-ups plus return-to-work incentive Volunteer days Internal Referral Incentive Staff Assistance Programme Annual Flu injections Sick leave from your first day on board Remote working options where practical and mutually agreed Daily fresh fruit basket, coffee machine, wide selection of teas and biscuits in all of our offices. We are also an accredited employer with INZ  Apply now | Tono inianei  Ready to take your career to the next level? We would love to hear from you!
