title: Business Analyst
description: The primary responsibility of the Business Analyst (BA) role is to support the realization of value through understanding applicable business process
jobType: Job Description    Business Analyst  Looking for a different challenge as a Business Analyst whereby you can still utilise your skills? Opportunity: Permanent Full-time Location: New Zealand - Wellington - Upper Hutt (Whakatiki) Hours of work: 40 hours per week Salary Bracket: NZD $75,000 to $95,000 Base, plus excellent benefits Upskill and growth in an area youre passionate about, whilst being fully supported and encouraged Join a trusted Global leading Animal Health organisation    The primary responsibility of the Business Analyst (BA) role is to support the realization of value through understanding applicable business processes, followed by the identification, implementation, and realization of appropriate and right-sized Information Technology (IT) solutions at the Global Animal Health Manufacturing (GAHM) site operations. IT improvements and innovations to be realized will be a combination of fit for purpose globally and locally driven solutions, always with a view to creating optimal value for the overall corporation.    The Business Analyst GAHM IT will act as a bridge between business challenges and technology solutions, will work under the leadership of the GAHM IT - ANZ Business Technology Partner, and will maintain a close relationship with a network of global platforms and teams in Animal Health (AH) and Digital within our companys Manufacturing Department as well as the automation and operational teams at the site. Additionally, the BA GAHM IT will assure full and continuous compliance with regulatory and company requirements, for example, CSV and SDLC.    What You Will Do    Responsibilities include, however not limited to:  Leadership  Support, design, and implement strategic, aligned, and compliant solutions to support business initiatives. Support the leadership vision, strategy, and policy for building a high-performance engagement model with the business units. Support building, designing, examining, and implementing well-organized and structured IT systems. Responsible for facilitating user-centric outcomes in daily operations, projects and product teams, including training and communication on how to use the systems. Planning, monitoring, organizing, and overseeing projects. Relationships - Build exceptional relationships with stakeholders that are focused on meeting the business needs. Global - Ensure that the solutions are aligned with AH IT platforms and support our companys GAHM strategy. Diversity - Respect diversity on project teams, different perspectives, ideas, and knowledge while working towards a common goal. Change ManagementAdopt high-quality change management practices with customers and stakeholders and implement sustainable solutions. Be a role model of our Companys Leadership Behaviours. Develop domain expertise in key Supply Chain and Manufacturing business processes, systems, and data. Support standardization of IT and automation systems implementation, aligned with both the deployment of new or upgraded manufacturing assets and the retrofit of integration with existing automated assets. Accountable for supporting and configuring relevant Technologies, ensuring appropriate support for operations and compliance with regulatory, safety, cyber security, business continuity, and financial requirements. Align with sites to implement modernization projects as part of a broader GAHM IT modernization program based on approved scope and timeline. Applying standard systems life cycle and other IT processes/methods, practices, and techniques to deliver process integration solutions. Ensures the operational stability, maintenance, performance, and compliance of a product or an application in production.    What You Must have    Bachelor's degree in engineering, science, information systems or related discipline, or equivalent and extensive related project experience. One to three years of experience in IT and in business process design. Experience with information technology systems in a pharmaceutical manufacturing environment. Knowledge of biological science processes and methods to inform information systems. Knowledge of process redesign methods (examples: business process re-engineering, Six Sigma, or total quality management). Knowledge of facilitation and Awareness of organization change management. Ability to adapt to rapidly changing technology and apply it to business needs. Strong business acumen, and easy rapport with peers and executives. Able to think out of the box on situation-dependent issues; Organizational savvy; leveraging social networks to escape hierarchy. Adept at managing diverse relationships across expertise, geography, and culture. Open and receptive to listening, and discerning pain points; Embraces new ideas, and evidence and fosters a collaborative atmosphere.  Eager to participate in Modernization or Digitization initiatives in Manufacturing Shop Floor with emerging technologies such as IoT. Also participate in the integration and management of Manufacturing Systems in Pharma/Biopharma/Medical Devices.    Preferred:  Exposure to consulting industry preferred Experience managing projects Situational analysis and decision-making abilities Ability to engage with software vendors and third-party solutions integrators    What You Can Expect  Exposure to upskill and develop in your role Flexibility and opening doors to other opportunities and skillsets Joining a collaborative team of likeminded individuals    We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one anothers thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

title: Senior Scrum Master
description: At SKY TV, we're on the lookout for a dynamic Senior Scrum Master to join our team and play a pivotal role in our Agile portfolio.
jobType: KO WAI MTOUI ABOUT SKY  Welcome to Sky, the ultimate entertainment destination that connects New Zealanders to the stories and sport they love, in ways tailored just for them. Our crew at Sky work tirelessly to ensure we are Aotearoa's most engaging and essential media company.  We are incredibly proud of our achievements, but that doesn't mean we're satisfied. As innovators, we constantly challenge ourselves to redefine boundaries and adapt to the ever-changing marketplace. Sustainability, profitability, and our dedication to Aotearoa are at the forefront of everything we do.  Our purpose is crystal clear. We share stories, we share possibilities, we share joy!  At Sky, we're embracing te ao Mori, diversity, and inclusion, and we value different perspectives and lived experiences. Now, let's dive into an incredible opportunity!  TE TRANGA I THE ROLE:  Are you an experienced Scrum Master passionate about Agile methodologies and leading high-performing teams? At SKY TV, we're on the lookout for a dynamic Senior Scrum Master to join our team and play a pivotal role in our Agile portfolio.  As a Senior Scrum Master, you will be at the forefront of facilitating portfolio-level events and processes, guiding our teams to deliver exceptional value. Youll champion a Lean-Agile mindset, ensure alignment with strategic business objectives, and drive continuous improvement across the portfolio.  KO NG ARONGA I- THE KEY AREAS OF FOCUS WILL BE:  Facilitate Planning: Prepare and lead Portfolio Planning sessions, ensuring team readiness and alignment with strategic goals. Support a Continuous Exploration process to shape vision, roadmaps, and backlogs.  Support Portfolio Execution: Track progress, address impediments, and promote DevOps and continuous delivery practices to keep our projects aligned with business objectives. Coach and Mentor: Act as the Chief Scrum Master, guiding and mentoring other Scrum Masters and team members to enhance their practices and uncover key insights. Optimize Flow: Implement pull systems and portfolio flow measures to streamline value delivery. Facilitate value stream mapping to identify and resolve bottlenecks. Improve Relentlessly: Drive continuous improvement at both team and portfolio levels. Utilize core competency self-assessments to boost technical and business practices. Collaborate: Work closely with Product Management, System Architects, and other Scrum Masters to ensure alignment between business vision and architectural goals. Build and maintain strong partnerships to support our business objectives.  NG PKENGA ME NG WHEAKO I- WHAT YOU WILL BRING  Leadership: Proven ability to lead Agile teams and manage large delivery teams and transformations effectively. Agile Expertise: Extensive experience (5+ years) in scaling Lean and Agile practices, with a solid understanding of Agile principles and methodologies. Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop and articulate strategies that align with business objectives and organizational goals. Communication: Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Collaboration: Strong client engagement skills with a knack for building and maintaining relationships and understanding client needs. Continuous Learning: A genuine commitment to lifelong learning and knowledge sharing. Qualifications: A tertiary or professional qualification in Information Technology or a related field, or equivalent experience.  KO NG HUANGA I WHATS IN IT FOR YOU?  At SKY TV, we value innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Join us to be part of a forward-thinking team where your expertise will drive our Agile transformation and help shape the future of our projects.  ME PHEA TE TONO I HOW TO APPLY  If this opportunity excites you and you want to join us in sharing stories, possibilities, and joy, apply online today. Please note that you must have the right to work in New Zealand or hold a valid work visa for at least 12 months from joining Sky.  At Sky, we understand that conventional recruitment processes may limit some individuals. That's why we strive to support all candidates, offering reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process. If you need any accommodations, please reach out to us at Sky jobs, jobs@sky.co.nz.  Are you ready to embark on an extraordinary journey with Sky? We cant wait for you to be part of our Sky crew. Apply now and seize the opportunity to be part of creating something amazing!  RECRTUITMENT AGENCIES  Please be aware that we have established partnerships with a small number of preferred suppliers and will not engage with unsolicited communication from agencies outside of this pool.

title: Advisor - Collections Experience | Optimisation, Performance and Development
description: This role provides key advice and handling of quality assurance, survey respondent feedback and query management within Collection Operations.
jobType: Advisor - Collections Experience | Optimisation, Performance and Development (Collection Operations) - Permanent  Join an organisation contributing to meaningful outcomes, About Aotearoa, for Aotearoa - data that improves lives today and for generations to come.  Flexible by default, balance life and work commitments Develop and grow your career (coaching, training, study support, secondments) Contribute to meaningful work that makes a difference to all people in Aotearoa 3 extra annual leave days (taken during Christmas office closure) City based offices that cater to a variety of working styles and needs  Mu | For you  Tatauranga Aotearoa Stats NZ are dedicated to diversity, equity, inclusion, health, and wellbeing. We welcome every gender, ethnicity, ability, religion, age, and background and encourage all our people to be their authentic selves.  Starting salary: $70,000 to $100,000 negotiable + superannuation  We encourage you to go to our careers site to learn more about working at Tatauranga Aotearoa Stats NZ, the Way We Work and our benefits. We want working for us to work for you!!  Nga waahi e waatea ana | Roles available  The Advisor - Collections Experience role sits within the Experience and Development team in the newly created Optimisation, Performance and Development unit in Collection Operations. This role provides key advice and handling of quality assurance, survey respondent feedback and query management within Collection Operations.  This will be a permanent, full-time position and commence as early as possible.  He aha te mahi | What's involved  The successful applicant will:  Provide advice around development of QA and experience frameworks to ensure alignment with organisation and best practice. Understand quality performance within collection activities and promote the use of quality tools. Utilise performance and experience insights/reporting to drive improvement of services over time and maintain a continuous improvement mindset. Contribute to the development of QA processes and documentation. Work collaboratively with key internal stakeholders, such as OCE, Legal/Privacy and People & Culture where required.  Ko wai pea ka pai | Who might be suited  We aim to match our people with mahi that complements their strengths and provide opportunities to learn and grow.  You will:  Have experience working in a effective QA and experience environment. Have experience using quality assurance systems, frameworks and tools and have knowledge of applied best practice. Have excellent collaboration skills with an ability to develop strong relationships to drive culture change with key stakeholders.  Me phea te tuku tono | How to apply  If this sounds like you, click on the Apply now button to be redirect to the application page on our careers site. The position description is located on the right-hand side of the page.  We are truly committed to diversity, equity, inclusion and lifting our cultural capability. You don't need to be knowledgeable in all these areas already, but you do need to be on board with learning and have a genuine interest and willingness to grow on this journey with us.  We will be screening applications as we receive them to move swiftly to interview shortly after the advert closes. You may be asked to complete a pre-interview screen via phone or video. Please let us know in your application if we need to make any specific accommodations during our process.  Please reach out to recruitment@stats.govt.nz if you have any questions.  You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand. Background and various pre-employment checks are part of our recruitment process.  Note to Recruitment Agencies: unsolicited CVs will not be accepted.

title: Business Analyst

title: Salesforce Developer - Omnistudio
description: Great opportunity to switch to an in-house role and join a collaborative and welcoming team
jobType: About the company Our client is a reputable, innovative and partnership driven insurance company that is backed by a large Australian firm. They have been around since 2015 and have experienced rapid growth since. They're people and technology first business that focuses on improving customer delivery and experience.  About the role We are seeking an experienced Salesforce Developer to join this dynamic team. You will play a crucial role in developing and enhancing the Salesforce platform, with a particular focus on Salesforce Omnistudio. Your contributions will directly impact the creation of user-friendly applications that improve customer experience and streamline operations  Responsibilities  Design, develop, and implement solutions using Salesforce Omnistudio. Document functional and technical requirements for new projects and enhancements. Ensure seamless migration and setup of code repositories and pipelines. Create user-friendly applications that enhance the customer experience. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver solutions. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Salesforce applications. Ensure the quality and performance of Salesforce applications. Stay updated with Salesforce best practices and emerging technologies What do you need? Min of 3+ years Salesforce development experience. Confidence building Salesforce solutions leveraging LWC, LWR, Omnistudioand APEX Proven track record of building user-friendly applications on the Salesforce platform. Proficiency in Salesforce configuration and administration tools. Relevant Omnistduio Salesforce Developer certifications Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. A customer-centric mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality solutions. Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, agile environment. Benefits? Generous Wellbeing Leave: 20 days of wellbeing (sick) leave per annum. Parental Leave: 1 week of paid parental discretionary leave for either parent. Wellbeing Allowance: $500 annual allowance to support your health and wellness. Insurance Discounts: Special rates on their insurance policies. Hybrid Working Environment: Enjoy the flexibility of both in-office and remote work. Dog-Friendly Offices: Bring your furry friend to work! Social Club: Engage with your colleagues in a fun and relaxed setting. Comprehensive Insurance: Life and income protection insurance. Career Development: Benefit from career coaching and professional development support. Employee Assistance Program: Access resources to support your personal and professional well-being. Due to nature of this position, we are only accepting applications from candidates who are already based in New Zealand and have existing working rights.  Need more info? Please contact yaman@84recruitment.co.nz

title: Cloud Architect
description: Standout opportunity to work alongside a team of technical experts and create industry-leading solutions for some of New Zealand's biggest clients.
jobType: About the Role  We have a standout opportunity at Inde for a Cloud Architect to join our highly skilled team of specialists and develop their skills at a cloud-first provider of enterprise technology business solutions.  Reporting to the Cloud Director, this permanent full-time role will see you working alongside a team of passionate, dedicated individuals to design and deliver outstanding solutions for our customers.  At Inde, we keep our systems simple and agile so that we're not constrained by processes and procedures. Rather than offering out-of-the-box solutions, you'll have the autonomy to use your consultancy skills in a customer focused, cross-team approach to ensure we deliver the best possible solution to address the customers key problems.  Key responsibilities of the role include:  Creating and implementing innovative, industry-leading solutions utilising your own expertise as well as the knowledge of your team Consulting with a diverse range of large, well-known enterprise customers, using your people skills and decision-making ability to take their dreams and turn them into a technical reality Taking on challenging projects that stretch you to develop your skills Engaging in regular training. Learning forms an essential part of your week. We invest heavily in upskilling our people by funding training, exams, and any resources needed to gain new certifications Growing the expertise of your team members through coaching and collaboration  Were looking for talented people based in Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch, or Dunedin who enjoy the flexibility of working under a hybrid work model. The role may also involve working at customer sites.    Perks and Benefits  Flexibility to work from home and the office in a supportive and collaborative hybrid environment. Work where you work best Investment in your career development. Growing our people is the why behind what we do A share of the profits each quarter. Every role is valued, we recognise that everyone plays their part Southern Cross health insurance, wellbeing initiatives Additional leave. Time away to enjoy the important things in life Quarterly team celebrations and regular social events. Connection and collaboration are essential to us    Skills and Experience  Above everything, were looking for Humble, Hungry, and Smart team players with a passion for technology and a sound knowledge of trends within the IT industry.  Our favourite technology is whatever works best to create great outcomes for our customers, but it is likely you will have certifications and experience in the following:  Expertise in on-premises infrastructure, cloud, hybrid platforms, and a strong understanding of the role of technology in meeting overall business goals. A significant number of years of experience in a breadth of AWS, Azure, M365, and general Wintel on-premises technologies and solutions. Expert understanding of the types of problems encountered by enterprise customers and the ability to apply technology knowledge to design innovative, efficient, and secure solutions. Effective communication skills, ensuring information is passed on to those who need it to keep our business moving forward, even when difficult conversations happen. A natural ability to get people on side and build rapport with customers, able to uncover problems that need to be solved and show customers how we can create a solution for them.  Your capability will also include: -  Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to build & maintain lasting relationships with clients. Previous experience in a professional services environment is highly desirable The ability to communicate complex topics in audience-appropriate detail and terminology Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Self-motivation and an ability to prioritise tasks  If you're excited about this role and think you have what it takes, but your experience doesn't align 100%, we still want to hear from you and would encourage you to apply.    About Inde  Inde is an employee-owned specialist technology company that has been carving its own path in New Zealands tech sector since 2016. We believe fresh perspectives bring great ideas and new energy, enabling our technology solutions to transform enterprises through innovative solutions. We are recognised as market leaders in Cloud, Networking, Security, Integration & Automation, Workspace, and Application Delivery. Our projects are led and delivered by technical experts who are empowered to create exceptional outcomes for our clients.  Our people are what makes us special, and were dedicated to encouraging new diverse talent to see technology as a great career choice as well as helping with the ongoing upskilling of our industry. We are about seeking the best way, not the next sale, partnering with our clients at every step to grow alongside them. We want to help shape our collective futures and drive sustainable progress. This will lead to a thriving, successful and diverse tech sector, and an ability to invest more in our people who can create meaningful impacts to our clients, communities, and country.  Our vision:To become the undisputed leader in technology services, transforming enterprises through innovative solutions Our purpose:Empowered by shared knowledge and learning, we relentlessly innovate to pursue exceptional outcomes together with our clients Our valuesare the basis for every decision we make at Inde, from how we work with clients, to how we treat each other.  To learn more about our values, head towww.inde.nz    How to Apply  Applyvia Seekif Inde seems like the kind of place for you.  Provide a copy of yourresume and a cover letteroutlining how you are a good match for our values (they really are that important to us).  After reviewing your application we'll reach out for a conversation if we appear to be well matched. Note that only applications received via Seek can be considered.  We want candidates to be the best version of themselves during the hiring process. If you have suggestions around how we can create a great experience for you, tell us. Or if you just have a question, reach out to us on0800 694 633.

title: BI Analyst
description: Be part of a large transformation project in a well established NZ business that are a leader in their field!
jobType: The company:  With a long history, our client has supported their sector by offering a wide range of products, services and solutions to their clients in New Zealand and internationally. They have one of the most engaged technically experienced and talented teams in the market, who take pride in creating and leading industry-leading products and services that deliver tangible benefits to their customers, using modern technologies and focusing on the growth and upskilling of their team to succeed as best as they can.  The role:  On offer is afixed term opportunity until the end of June 2025,for a BI Analyst in their Christchurch office, best suited to an Intermediate or someone wanting to enter in a Senior-level role.  You will work with stakeholders to build leading reporting solutions, provide analytical insights, define business requirements, design solutions, and support implementations that ensure business needs are met.  You'll work with a fantastic team of other Analysts and Data Warehouse Developers, in an environment focused on collaboration and always taking the best approach for the team and business.  The ideal candidate will have:  Expertise with the usage of Microsoft BI toolset Proven commercial experience with Power BI, SQL, M and DAX. Familiarity with Data Warehousing and Data Modelling Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills The ability to exercise a balanced and informed approach to problem solving and supporting change The capability to source and analyse data, draw value-based conclusions, and present via appropriate data visualisations is essential What's in it for you?  Great benefits and a generous, market-based salary on a fixed term basis (until June 2025) A hybrid workplace, with flexibility to work from 1 day a week and flexible hours. Opportunities to make your mark within a project that is crucial for their business growth and maturation. Retail and fuel discounts, a work phone and plan. If this role sounds like you, then send your most up to date CV by clicking the 'Apply Now' button below or contact James Hurren for more details at james.hurren@crewconsulting.co.nz.

title: Systems & Technology Manager
description: A fantastic opportunity for an experienced Systems & Technology Manager.
jobType: Mmtou | About us:  Te Puia is situated within the historic Te Whakarewarewa Geothermal Valley, spanning 70 hectares in Rotorua. Home to the iconic Phutu geyser, bubbling mud pools, hot springs, and silica formations, Te Puia is full of natural wonders. Manuhiri (visitors) can also explore the native Kiwi bird and the prestigious national schools of wood carving, weaving and stone and bone carving. For over 170 years, we have been sharing these taonga (treasures) with manuhiri and proudly continue this tradition today.  As an iwi-owned business operating under the NZ Mori Arts and Crafts Vesting Act 2020, we have a longstanding tradition of welcoming manuhiri from around the world to experience the magic of Te Whakarewarewa Thermal Valley. Our core values of manaakitanga (hospitality) and kaitiakitanga (guardianship) guide everything we do, ensuring that every visitor is treated with respect and becomes part of our whnau (family). We are dedicated to protecting and preserving the natural and cultural treasures of Te Puia for future generations.  M te tnga | About the role:  We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Systems & Technology Manager to join our team. The primary focus of this role is to lead the transition to a new reservations platform with API connectivity, oversee the enhancement of our e-commerce capabilities, and explore the opportunities and impacts of adopting AI technology. You will play a pivotal role in optimising our technological infrastructure to ensure seamless operations and an exceptional guest experience.  Reporting directly to the GM Operations and with specific deliverables to the GM Sales & Marketing, you will manage the technological backbone of Te Puia, ensuring that our systems support our strategic objectives and operational needs.  A full position description is available on request.  Ng pmanawatanga u | What you will bring:  Bachelors degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in a technology management role, preferably in the tourism or hospitality industry. Proven track record of successfully managing technology projects, particularly system implementations and integrations. Strong understanding of ecommerce platforms and digital marketing strategies. Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively engage and influence stakeholders at all levels. Solid technical expertise across a range of systems and technologies, including reservation systems, CRM systems, and ecommerce platforms. Experience with cloud-based solutions and SaaS providers. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail. Relevant certifications (e.g., ITIL, PMP, CISSP) are a plus. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Strategic planning, project management, and relationship building skills. A positive attitude that emphasises and encapsulates the values of Te Puia.  Nu te rourou |Whats in it for you:  Continuous training and development Comprehensive medical and life insurance cover Enjoy a complimentary free lunch every Friday Access to wellbeing initiatives, including an Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) and Wellbeing Allowance Additional benefits and rewards apply  Mephea te tuku tono |How to apply:  If youre excited about joining our team, apply online today with a covering letter explaining why youre the perfect fit, along with an up-to-date CV. Please only apply if you have the legal right to work in New Zealand. Preferred applicants will undergo pre-employment checks, including Ministry of Justice and drug testing.  For more information about Te Puia, visit www.tepuia.com. Positions may remain open until suitable candidates are found.  Join us at Te Puia and be a part of the legacy!

title: Test Analyst (Manual)
description: Test Analyst (Manual) - NZ business focussed on improving community outcomes - Auckland CBD - Competitive Salary - Hybrid Working - Growth Potential
jobType: Test Analyst (Manual)  About the company:  We are currently looking for a Test Analyst (manual) with around 3-5 years of experience to join a growing tech division in the heart of Auckland CBD. This New Zealand business operates on a region-wide basis within the public sector and has a particular focus on maximizing social, cultural and economic benefits.  About the role:  In this role you will have the opportunity to work with cross-functional teams across a variety of projects and take ownership over manual testing elements. You will be able to work autonomously within a supportive team and learning framework. The right person would have a keen interest in new technologies while fostering a growth mindset. Experience using JIRA / working in an Agile environment. Basic SQL skills. Great communication skills.    Nice to have:  Salesforce testing experience    On offer:  Hybrid working Competitive salary Training budget available Additional benefits package    If you're interested in this role, please apply via the 'Quick Apply' button or send your updated CV to maarten.wurtz@randstaddigital.co.nz  Please note that at this stage, we can only consider candidates based in New Zealand with valid working rights.  At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description: We are looking for an experienced Systems Administrator that's a collaborative problem solver.
jobType: Bell Gully is independently recognised as New Zealands leading commercial law firm. With a team of over 200 lawyers combining market-leading corporate, commercial, financial services, tax, projects & real estate and dispute resolution capability with a wide array of specialist skills, we consistently deliver practical solutions to everyday and unique problems. Our IT department is looking for an enthusiastic and talented Senior Systems Administrator to join our Auckland team. We are interested in speaking with candidates who are organised and can build relationships easily with their team. Prior professional services firm experience is strongly preferred.   Purpose of the position:  Reporting to the Service Delivery Manager, this role is responsible for IT systems and network services within Bell Gully. This role is a hands-on, technical position, requiring a high level of technical expertise. The roles overarching responsibilities include adherence and contributing to the firms information security management system (ISMS), management and support of firewall configuration, server and database support.  Main responsibilities (non-exhaustive):  Maintain and improve core infrastructure and systems with a strong focus on information security. Maintain and improve security and risk management practices. Maintain and improve high availability and disaster recovery processes Contribute to, and support the incident response process.  To be successful in this role you must have:  Experience in systems and network administration/management, experience in a LAN/WAN environment. Experience with Windows server, Active Directory, DNS, Office 365, Microsoft SCCM, PowerShell. Previous exposure to implementing and managing data, routers, WAN/LAN, TCP/IP, wireless and mobile technologies. Previous experience with server and network design, architecture, implementation, and support. Proficient with building / configuring networked Microsoft Windows client devices. Desktop application packaging and scripting. Worked with VMware, vSphere and with a SAN environment. Experience with firewall configuration (preferably Palo Alto). Experience with Cisco/Juniper switches and routers. Experience supporting a large-scale enterprise document management system. Knowledge and experience of network security, intrusion detection, design knowledge of internet architecture. Experience with security solutions and Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), preferably Cortex XDR.  Culture and benefits:  In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:  Community support programmes, A comprehensive health and wellbeing programme, An annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities; Sports teams, an annual ball, regular social events  Please apply directly or contact Liberty Greenwood (09) 916 8708 for a confidential discussion.   We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome.  As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set.

title: Senior Systems Consultant
description: Looking for a rewarding client facing role with a great employer? Bring your skills to CommArc and work with a market leader.
jobType: About Us  For nearly 30 years, CommArc has been helping all kinds of Kiwi businesses to be successful by resolving IT issues and delivering new technology solutions.  CommArc is a managed IT and cloud service provider. We look after New Zealand businesses by working smart and delivering the goods.  We are now seeking a client facing Senior Systems Consultant based at Christchurch head office who enjoys a mix of architecture, planning plus project delivery work.  About You  Its important that you have a flair for relationship building with clients, including the fine art of translating business plans and goals into deliverable IT solutions and services.  A background in senior technical support or project delivery roles is ideal, and the technical skills we are looking for are:  Windows Server deployment, configuration and troubleshooting Active Directory & Group Policy 365 administration Intune configuration and deployment Mail flow design, set up and administration  A good working knowledge of networking, security and access control will be an advantage.  We are a close knit team at CommArc and there will be good opportunity for learning, upskilling and personal development. Our client base is varied, so our work offers excellent experience with companies of different sizes in several sectors.  An excellent six figure salary is on offer, plus off street parking, car allowance and health insurance.

title: Senior Project Manager
description: Lead digital transformation at The Instillery! Join us as a Senior Project Manager for impactful projects, growth opportunities and flexible work.
jobType: We are open to candidates in Auckland or Hamilton.  The Instillery is an award-winning 100% Kiwi owned company headquartered right here in Aotearoa. Were a technology company that provides multi-disciplined professional services and business consulting across infrastructure, applications, cloud, security and modern work solutions to some of New Zealand's best organisations.  Our Senior Project Managers are responsible for managing and delivering well run, profitable projects that provide best in class outcomes to our clients. Youll lead best practice industry standards in project methodology, managing the polished development of projects, their stakeholders, and resources across a diverse range of digital projects.  The role will involve:  The effective management and delivery of projects to exceed our clients expectations including on budget, on point regular comms, and progress tracking. Leading communications with the client throughout the entire project lifecycle, maintaining effective relationships both internally and externally in a professional manner. Debriefing and sharing any learnings from implementations across the business to improve future projects for innovations, templates etc Managing all financial aspects of the project, ensuring accurate and timely tracking of costs against budget, project invoicing, processing timesheets of the technical resources allocated to the project, tracking expenditure against the forecast and updating as required. Providing solutions for any problems that occur during the project lifecycle and approaching them in a systematic manner.  For you we have:  Good people to surround yourself with, accessible supportive leaders, no bureaucracy, fast decision making and the size and scale to make real change. Professional development through training, certifications and industry events. Competitive base rem + benefits including your birthday and a wellbeing day off, plus medical insurance. Flexible work: 3 days in office and 2 from home to support true work/life balance.  Were looking for someone with a positive, helpful, can-do attitude, that is proactive and has a natural ability to understand, relate and translate customer requirements and expectations and simply gets people.  You must be self-managed with the right attitude to take ownership to execute successful projects and ideally youll have five years or more experience managing medium to large sized modernising/transformation type projects (Cloud, Data, Modern Work and Network).  If you are interested in joining something special we would love to hear from you.

title: SAP BW Support Consultant - New Zealand based

title: ICT Manager
description: The ICT Manager will oversee & manage the IT services, plan & implement IT strategies, supervise teams, & ensure infrastructure security & efficiency.
jobType: Who are we?  Cartrack is a fast-growing service-centric company committed to providing excellent products and services in GPS Tracking and Fleet Management. We have earned a reputation for consistently delivering best-in-class fleet, workforce management, and customer service solutions.    The Opportunity  CARTRACK is looking for anICT Manager who will oversee and manage the IT services, plan and implement IT strategies, supervise IT teams, and ensure IT infrastructure security and efficiency.    KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:  Managing the daily operations of the ICT department, ensuring the security and integrity of the organization's data, and overseeing the maintenance of ICT infrastructure, including hardware, software, and networks. Checking GPS streaming and run-away events by analysing GPS device debugging information. Building CANBUS vehicle profiles through reverse vehicle data engineering. Fault finding on GPS tracking devices' PCB boards. Managing Asterisk PBX systems, virtual and network environments. Responsible for developing disaster recovery and business continuity plans, product development, ensuring the reliability of the product to end users, and conducting regular audits of ICT systems and processes Formulating, developing, and implementing information and communication technology strategies, policies, and procedures. Overseeing ICT projects, including system upgrades and new implementations Analysing information needed for technology development to meet evolving client requirements. Managing relationships with external vendors and service providers.    JOB REQUIREMENTS:  Minimum of 5 years solid experience in ICT management preferably with relevant IT qualifications Must have 2 years of experience in the GPS Tracking industry, specifically in GPS Telematics. Experience in troubleshooting/debugging telematics devices and embedded software/firmware, and vehicle CANBUS data reversal Proven track record of product development and delivery in the fleet management industry. Proficiency in IT systems, Windows Server Administration, and Powershell Scripting. Willingness to work outside of normal office hours for collaboration/meetings with team leads, engineers, and developers in South Africa, Singapore, and Portugal.  **Note: Not to be confused with overtime (part of the 40 hours/week will be undertaken outside of 8 am-5 pm hours due to time zone differences)    WHAT WE OFFER:  Salary range between $130,000  $138,000 per year Permanent and full-time employment with a minimum of 40 hours of work per week Flexible work schedule to work outside of normal office hours for collaboration/meetings with team leads, engineers, and developers in South Africa, Singapore, and Portugal. Tools of trade to be able to perform your job (mobile phone and laptop) Ongoing training and development opportunities An immediate start

title: Data & AI GTM Manager
description: Partner across Microsoft core teams to bring the voice of field and co-design strategy and programs.
jobType: Overview  For the Asia Data & AI GTM team, our mission is to help every organization in Asia to maximize the value of their data with a unified data and analytics platform, and by delivering innovative solutions that use the Azure AI platform. We do this by building GTM programs that enable our sales teams, generate demand with our customers, and orchestrate all parts of our organization to deliver on this mission.  The Sales Enablement & Operations (SE&O) team plays an essential role in translating Microsofts Commercial Strategy to a local execution plan and driving operational excellence to achieve the greatest results possible. Our team drives cross-Region, cross-Area and cross-Subsidiary insight and execution excellence, bringing strategy and priorities to life by accelerating the pace of transformation and enabling Microsoft to deliver business impact at scale.  As the Data & AI GTM Manager pinned to ANZ, your role is to help our ANZ Area teams achieve our growth targets for Azure Data Services. We do this by leading the execution of our Data & AI Solution Plays and by running targeted Managed Account Activities. This opportunity will help you understand how Microsoft operates across all engines, build domain expertise covering the data, analytics and AI market in Asia, and develop deep business acumen by represent the ANZ business to regional and corporate leaders. This role covers all Australia and New Zealand, and will require some travel across the Area and within Asia.  This role allows for flexible work allowing for up to 50% of work from home.  Microsofts mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  Qualifications  Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs)  8+ years marketing strategy, business planning, sales enablement, business development, technical pre-sales, or related work experience. OR equivalent experience  Additional or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)  12+ years marketing strategy, business planning, sales enablement, business development, technical pre-sales, or related work experience AND Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field OR equivalent experience. 8+ years experience managing and expanding a product/solution portfolio and driving demand generation and pipeline acceleration within a complex (e.g., multinational or matrixed) organization. Cloud Platform. Understanding of Microsoft Cloud platform, or other public cloud platforms, including IaaS and PaaS technologies and how they translate into business impact. Versed in data migration and modernization, analytics and AI. Competitive Landscape. Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud and datacenter infrastructure competitor landscape including AWS and GCP Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.  Responsibilities  Drive Business Performance Partners with Areas to drive GTM for aligned Solution Plays, identifying growth opportunities in the market and builds clear execution plans. Align, influence and coach field teams, sales operations, marketing plans, business rhythms and change management to convert strategic priorities into local execution. Partners across Microsoft core teams to bring the voice of field and co-design strategy and programs. Leads Sales Enablement Lands and champions solution plays, activating connected sales and marketing execution in every segment to maximize performance and share. Lead and collaborate with GPS for local partner-led marketing strategies and demand generation that support solution play performance. Champions Microsoft strategy and Solution Areas and builds industry presence. Champions Product Advocacy Advocates as the voice of the Customer, Partners and Field to provide thought leadership on competitive landscape, solution area gaps, sales trends, etc. to drive improvements on the GTM plan. Grows organization capability to drive true insights, learnings and blockers for leaders, managers, and sellers. Drives standardized rhythms and tools that drive increased customer and partner facing time for sellers.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.  Industry leading healthcare Educational resources Discounts on products and services Savings and investments Maternity and paternity leave Generous time away Giving programs Opportunities to network and connect

title: Technical Integration Analyst
description: We're seeking a Technical Integration Analyst with a strong software engineering mindset + relationship management skills to deliver great outcomes
jobType: Requirement gathering, elicitation and analysis, Business Systems Analysis Analytical skills, Systems Implementation design and Domain consulting, scalable API, Business rules M mtou | About us  Tnui Ake Nei | Thriving Aotearoa is our vision for a future where we work together so that all people and their communities can live the lives they value.  M te tranga mahi | About the role  As a Technical Integration Analyst, you'll be taking a lead in the technical analysis of integration challenges and ideas, you will work within cross functional teams of architects, designers, testers and developers and take ownership over the technical integration analysis practice to build a consistent set of information assets to understand, describe and map how we deliver business value through integration solutions.  The Technical Integration Analyst will capture, create and document modern, fast, beautiful and highly scalable APIs that grow and evolve continuously in a resilient and secure ecosystem.  In this role you will have a strong software engineering mindset, coupled with the ability to work closely with other experts in analysis, design and quality assurance to deliver great outcomes.  To view a full position description, please click here.  Nga Pkenga Motuhake | Important Skills  As a Technical Integration Analyst you will:   Collaborate with business users, technology teams and vendors to establish and prioritize business and technology requirements. Work in partnership with domain architects, designers and product owners with prototyping and developing APIs and integration solutions specifications, reference models and patterns. Identify and promote opportunities to extend and enhance our solutions and products by defining and refining ACC technical documentation standards and guidelines. Inspire and provide technical steer over the technical analysis practice, establishing a strong foundation for great products and services development. Strong communication and analytical skills combined with at least 7 years of experience in business analysis, systems implementation design or domain consulting. Solid understanding of Contract first/API first architectural and software engineering principles. Domain driven Data modelling experience and knowledge. Good working understanding of modern Integration patterns and technologies. A passion to explore and use new technology/approaches to solve problems. Familiarity with Test-Driven Development and event based architecture. Experience in CI/CD Agile DevOps industry standards and tools for story writing, mapping and data modelling and testing. Working at ACC  The base salary range for this role starts at $101,287 with starting salary depending on the skills and experience of the successful applicant. ACC also offers an additional 9% superannuation.  We know that a diverse and inclusive team helps us meet the needs of our customers and we welcome candidates from every ethnicity, national origin, gender identity, age, and those with a disability or who have additional mental health needs. It is important to us that people are free to be themselves at work. Here are some ways we encourage that:   Employee networks to support our colleagues from diverse backgrounds. The option to explore flexible working that suits your needs and ours. Development opportunities in te reo Mori me na tikanga.  Applications close 5pm Wednesday 14th August and can only be accepted when submitted through the ACC careers site. If you encounter accessibility issues when submitting your application, or if you have any questions about the role, please email hrhelp@acc.co.nz

title: Head of Managed Services - Cyber Security
